Title_Description: add imagemagick processor so some other image types can be processed i wanted to talk about this for a while but always seemed to forget. how about we start using imagemagick for reading images for content pipeline.why? supported formats for one which include both gimp(xcf) and photoshop(psd) formatsit also has a .net wrapper worst case scenario if we cant actually use it as a replacement for our current method we could still make it convert the file to some known format for us. ive only ever used it as a linux terminal command.cc.  tomspilman  konajugames  dellis1972

Title_Description: color.lerpprecise - what does the description tell? hello ive been playing around with colors and i got to color.lerpprecise. now the description states the following performs linear interpolation of microsoft.xna.framework.color using microsoft.xna.framework.mathhelper.lerpprecise(system.singlesystem.singlesystem.single) on mathhelper. less efficient but more precise compared to microsoft.xna.framework.color.lerp(microsoft.xna.framework.colormicrosoft.xna.framework.colorsystem.single). see remarks section of microsoft.xna.framework.mathhelper.lerpprecise(system.singlesystem.singlesystem.single) on mathhelper for more info.what did you guys mean less efficient? i know lerpprecise ensures the color gets properly calculated but how is lerp more efficient than it? i tried to search the internet for this but couldnt find much...

Title_Description: suggestion using openal soft on os x following a couple tweets with ethan ( it may be interesting to update opentk.dll.config (and the future monogame.framework.dll.config once opentk is replaced) to look for openal soft dylib instead of the os x system library (and then push the dependencies to monogame/monokickstart and make sure that it works on xammac).this would help maintaining the openal implementation across the desktopgl platforms in the future.ive already seen the apple implementation having differences (e.g. different return values than oal soft) and some 8-22khz sounds dont render the same than on other platforms.

Title_Description: [desktopgl] heavy song volume fluctuation hellofirst i should note that i dont know if the problem comes from the oggstreamer / nvorbis openal or my own code.when playing song for an extended time (from 5 to 10 minutes and it doesnt matter if it is the same song or a queue of different ones) it happens very often that the song playing volume changes by itself without any call to mediaplayer in the last couple minutes and it can go from plain 0 to 1.this happens on all platforms with openal-soft or apple/creatives one and only affects song not soundeffect.our game can be very soundeffect intensive and song are cross-faded by code. at first i thought that i was putting to much pressure on the openal command buffer but even adding locks to have a max of 10 al calls per second doesnt change anything and the problem can happen in moments when absolutely no soundeffect is playing for several seconds.any thoughts?

Title_Description: texture2d.fromstream test this is something i noticed in xna behavior porting a game to ps4.if you have a texture that is filled with the color  r255 g128 b64 a0.  when you load this texture via texture2d.fromstream the resulting texture has the color r0 g0 b0 a0.if you have a texture that is filled with the color  r255 g128 b64 a1...  texture2d.fromstream returns a texture with the color r255 g128 b64 a1.so although the xna docs for texture2d.fromstream explicitly state that it returns non-premultiplied colors... it does however clear the color channels if the alpha channel is 0.i dont know if monogame matches xna in this regard or not.  we need to implement a specific unit test with a special test texture to verify the results.secondarily we should consider adding an overload that lets you disable this color channel clearing as it was unexpected.  i can see how it would be useful to not have it modify the loaded color data.
Name: help wanted

Name: unknown

Title_Description: add color(uint) and color(bytebytebytebyte) constructors when you have to initialize a bunch of colors the current setters and constructors are inefficient.  they all do internal math to scale or clamp values to back to a byte then pack them.  often this math isnt needed but is there just in case someone passes an out of range value.i suggest extending the api to support two additional constructors directly taking a packed value and channel bytesthese would be the most efficient constructors one could use.we should also document the packed format in the reference docs on the new ctor and the packed value getter/setter.
Name: feature request

Title_Description: rasterizerstate.depthbias not working as expected the depthbias in monogame is not working the same way as in xna.im not 100  sure but it looks like xna is applying the depthbias value set in rasterizerstate in a way that matches the depth buffer format.in xna i have used a value of -0.0004f (this is quite much) to offset a transparent area border above the landscape.this didnt work at all in monogame and after some investigation i found out that monogame just passes the value to directx without modification and directx applies it as a factor to a very small number that is calculated based on the depth buffer format.my theory now is that xna does some math with the depthbias value to make it easier for the developer to deal with it.in my case (24bit depth buffer) the following formula gives exactly the same visual result as -0.0004f in xnastate.depthbias = (float)(-0.0004f / (1 / math.pow(2 24)))
Name: help wanted

Title_Description: mouse event handler works inconsistently on xamarin.mac but is fine on monomac ive tried doing mouse drag event handling in both monogame base and monogame.extended and for some reason xamarin.mac projects do not work as expected while monomac projects work fine.  i can capture drag events with the middle mouse button but the right and left mouse buttons do not drag.  i tried this with some xna drag and drop code i ported and then further tested with a brand new project using the the monogame.extended inputlistener demo code.  this seems like a bug where the mouse movement events arent firing for some reason while the button is in a pressed state.
Name: help wanted| macos

Title_Description: hlsl buffers incorrectly calculated? i have a shader that causes an argumentexception offset and length were out of bounds for the array or count is greater than the number of elements from index to the end of the source collection.the stack trace is as follows   at system.buffer.blockcopy(array src int32 srcoffset array dst int32 dstoffset int32 count)   at microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.constantbuffer.setdata(int32 offset int32 rows int32 columns object data)   at microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.constantbuffer.setparameter(int32 offset effectparameter param)   at microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.constantbuffer.update(effectparametercollection parameters)   at microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.effectpass.apply()after some really low-level probing i was able to determine that the effects constantbuffer(s) seems to have been incorrectly allocated. my vertex shader has four float4x4 parameters and as such the offsets are correctly set as 0 64 128 192. however the constantbuffers buffer is only 240 bytes rather than the necessary 256. it looks as though its reading that sizeinbytes figure from the compiled shader effect code so does that mean the hlsl compiler is doing something wrong? or is there something else that im overlooking?
Name: unknown

Title_Description: xb1 uwp doesnt like how our static vbs and ibs are created for some reason on xb1 via uwp both vertexbuffer and indexbuffer fail to work but dynamicvertexbuffer and dynamicindexbuffer work fine.what is particularly curious about this is that things work perfectly fine under uwp on windows 10 desktops and on uwp under raspberry pi.  also the exact same code works on windows 7 vista and windows 8.  it is just on xb1 where the non-dynamic buffers fail to work.i suspect it is either something something in buffer setupor it is something in the buffer setdata which takes a different path for dynamic vs static buffers  it could very well be that the code that has worked for 5 years now on every other dx platform has been wrong and the drivers and/or the dx runtime has been letting us get away with it.

Title_Description: [directx] reach profile can crash on dx10+ gpus that dont support intermediate feature levels some gpus support directx 10_0 feature level but dont support all 9_x feature levels.  in my case a laptop gpu supports only 10_0   9_1 (no 9_2   9_3). shaders that use ps_4_0_level_9_3 will crash on that laptop when using _reach_ graphicsprofile.  they work with other gpus under reach and they work on this laptop when using hidef profile.  problem is that mg tries to make a device with feature level 9_3 first when graphicsprofile is set to reach. when that fails 9_1 device is created although 10_0 is supported. this results in crash when trying to use 9_3 shaders.  proposed solution by  jjagg is that monogame should always try to create a device with the highest possible feature level to prevent this issue. even under reach.
Name: directx

Title_Description: expose keydown / keyup events in gamewindow class. currently the gamewindow class expose a textinput event to allows the creation of text boxes and other similar ui events. however this event only fires when characters are typed   and common function buttons like backspace or delete dont trigger this event  .  to provide full functionality to a textbox like ui control   we currently need to emulate the behavior   by checking the key state in the keyboard class in an update() loop. however this emulation is not perfect because even if implement it to emulate the keyboard delays and repeat speed if the user hit rapidly the backspace stroke (for example) as the update loop is running by default at 60hz   we may miss some keystrokes  .    this gives the end user a laggy experience  . i suggest to implement the keydown and keyup events as well (and from what i see in opentkgamewindow theyre already used its just a matter of exposing them) in the gamewindow so the user of the framework could have a finer grained control of the keyboard and would not have to rely on sort of emulation to provide erasing capabilities to a text box.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: rectangle bugs  rectangle.isempty  and  rectangle.empty  should be corrected as using either of these could lead to bugs via false negatives.  the current implementation is  i realize this is legacy dragged along from xna but regardless its still incorrect and bugged against what should be expected behavior.  this also applies to the  rectangle.empty  constant which really shouldnt be labeled the definitive state of an empty rectangle. as mentioned above the x and y positions have no context in whether it is empty and only a width   or   height of 0 indicate emptiness. removing or renaming the  rectangle.empty  constant could be a breaking change to anyone compiled against it to determine emptiness in their code which sucks but if theyre depending on this being the only form of an empty rectangle possible than their code is already bugged.  any chance on a pull request to correct this or any thoughts against a pr for this?

Title_Description: monogame 3.7 stops ios background music on startup with no workaround < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- monogame 3.7 has a regression from 3.6 where the ios audio session category is incorrectly set to avaudiosessioncategory.soloambient in openalsoundcontroller.cs.  this immediately stops background music and breaks the workaround in issue 735 which was to set the audio session category to avaudiosessioncategory.ambient in finishedlaunching.  in my opinion monogame should not override the audio category set by the developer and this code should be deleted.  for one of my games (a party game where audio is essential) i want to use avaudiosessioncategory.playback with the option avaudiosessioncategoryoptions.mixwithothers and secondaryaudioshouldbesilencedhint in order to create an experience where my game sound effects always play (even if the ringer is muted) and my background music only plays if some other background music isnt already playing.  for another of my games (a puzzle game where audio is not essential) i want to use ambient so my sound is silenced when the ringer is muted.  my point is that there isnt a single category that the monogame framework should dictate for every game. the framework should leave this setting up to the game developer.  also note that monogame is not setting avaudiosessioncategory when the application is resumed/activated so im able to get the correct behavior if the user switches back to the music app restarts the music and switches back to my game. however i dont consider this a viable workaround.  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7   what operating system are you using - ios   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - ios
Name: unknown

Title_Description: proposition to port math to native implementation < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- ive used monogame for about a year but then decided to switch languages and ended up on rust. i have missed monogame but i dont really want to leave rust as its an amazing programming language. so i came up with the idea to integrate rust with monogame and thought that perhaps the math portion could be ported for ease of use instead of anything too complicated to put into an ffi. i wrote a test and low and behold i have great results   matrix.createlookat()  |                            | monogame implementation | rust native implementation | |----------------------------|-------------------------|----------------------------| | time (ticks)               | 17 551 010.16           | 314 615.39                 | | time (ms)                  | 5273.5                  | 94.5                       | | memory (mb) (vs debugger)  | 71.1                    | 76.2                       | | memory (mb) (task manager) | 68.5                    | 69.1                       | | cpu  (task manager)        | 15 ~ 17.5              | 16 ~ 18.5                 |  here is my configuration for reference  |                  | config                                         | |------------------|--------------------------------------------| | target (rust)    | nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc --release | | target (c)      | any cpu (release)                          | | os               | windows 10                                 | | monogame version | latest stable (3.7.1)                      | | .net version     | .net framework 4.7.1                       | | cpu              | intel(r) core(tm) i7-6700 cpu   3.40ghz    | | ticks per second | 3328129 |  so im asking _if_ i were to rewrite alot of the math functions in monogame in rust would it ever be accepted? (of course id make sure to keep the implementation outputting the same result)  [the source for my tests](  edit i later realized that while rust _does_ compile to many platforms it doesnt compile to all so it _may_ not have support for some of the less prominent targets that monogame targets. edit 2 i was actually looking at datetime for ticks per second but i was actually using the stopwatch.frequency ticks per second
Name: performance

Title_Description: desktopgl emulates dx9 half pixel offset  what operating system are you using - windows desktopgl  there is a rendering difference between the directx and opengl versions of monogame when using the basiceffect. because the half pixel offset for opengl is not taken into account. while this is taken into account for the spritebatch  game.framework/graphics/graphicsdevice.opengl.csl272  this means that anything rendered with the basiceffect shader is slightly blurry on opengl. for example see these two screenshots  opengl  [text_a](  directx  [text_c](  i think we should give the user some way to know that the half pixel offset should be set by themselves or change the opengl shader for the basiceffect to fix this.  what do you think? i can make a pr once ive gathered more input ).
Name: help wanted| opengl

Title_Description: webvr and web assembly - possibility in the future hello there  this is something to put in your pipe and smoke... or open discussion.  i have recently been interested in seeing if monogame could work with [blazor]( i have come to the conclusion that i will have to wait for .net core support  planned in [3.8 release](  two of the [use cases for web assembly]( are virtual reality and games both of which monogame would be great for.  i am also interested by a webvr project called [a-frame]( which uses threejs and i believe that in the future monogame could be used for a similar project built from server-side [razor components]( rather than client-side (custom) html.  in fact the [demo on the web assembly website]( is tanks  which is a unity game built in c i would assume (unless the wasm guys converted to c++) so it is realistic to think that monogame could also be used with web assembly in the same way.  as well as all this a monogame web app built with blazor could also open up [electron]( and [cordova]( as new platforms.  what do you think about all this?   blazor is still experimental so it could be distant future stuff but still possible.  luke
Name: feature request

Title_Description: ui issue in content pipeline tool with extended.content.pipeline.dll < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  the pipeline tool appears to have an issue with the ui when working with .tmx files from tiled. after adding a reference to monogame.extended.content.pipeline.dll the tool reports invalid / missing importer(processor) in the properties window after selecting content project files. also after adding a .tmx file to the content project it looks like this in the content.mgcb file   the content project builds fine however even when right-clicking on the .tmx file and selecting rebuild.   < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7.0.7 - pipeline tool 3.7.0.1708   what operating system are you using - windows 7 x64   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - desktopgl

Title_Description: wrong parameter order for mgcb.exe in .targets file < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  the parameter order in monogame.content.builder.targets for mgcb.exe seems to be wrong in concern of cross-platform projects. the /platform paramter should come after the /  parameter in order to correctly overwrite the platform in order to have platform specific projects (with shared content) built their content correctly.  ..in the current order the /platform parameter is always ignored when a .mgcb file is provided - which happens to be the case in cross-platform with shared project  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - not relevant
Name: unknown

Title_Description: no autocomplete/intellisense in shared project. < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --    autocomplete/intellisense does not work in a monogame shared project.    steps to reproduce  1. create a new monogame shared project. 2. right click on the solution and create a new monogame dx or opengl project. 3. add the shared project as a reference to the dx/gl project.     a. when i do this the using statement in the shared project using microsoft.xna.framework.storage; throws an error the type or namespace storage does not exist in the namespace monogame.xna.framework. im not sure whats up with that. 4. create a new class in the shared project. 5. begin typing the prop shortcut for creating a property.  6. there is no autocomplete or intellisense. pressing tab does not trigger the prop shortcut. also i am unable to use the ; character at all.  im only able to fix this by unloading and reloading the shared project but i dont want to have to do that every time i make a new class.  im using visual studio professional 2017 version 15.9.4 as well as jetbrains resharper ultimate 2018.3.1.  example   < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7.0.1708   what operating system are you using - windows 10 pro version 1803 build 17164.523   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - shared desktopgl windowsdx

Title_Description: songs wont play on ios < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- hi i experienced a weird issue trying to playing songs under ios. i imported my_song.mp3 file via content pipeline (using mp3 importer - monogame) and load and play it as follows  song msx = content.load<song(my_song); microsoft.xna.framework.media.mediaplayer.play(msx);   all the things goes well no errors was generated and the microsoft.xna.framework.media.mediaplayer.state is playing but no music is audible (of course the volume is correctly set...). i tried with various format/version of mp3 and also with .ogg with the same result.  i tried to downgrade to release 3.6 and the above code works well. in simulator and in real devices the songs play fine. so i think it’s an issue of the latest 3.7 / 3.7.1 releases of monogame. i am very curious to discover the reasons of this bug...  any idea?  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7 / monogame 3.7.1   what operating system are you using - macos (write and compile using xamarin studio)   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - ios

Title_Description: spritebatcher performance issue on 8000+ spritebatch.draw per second < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  <sspritebatcher class has a member private vertexpositioncolortexture[] _vertexarray;. when draw count per seconds goes to 150000-20000 per second. that array member size get increased heavely and then cause high latency gc on next batch draw.</s  <sthis may be the reason my games draw lag which can go to 300ms and 80ms on average draw.</s  edit this is not that reason cause lag. i must be something in other place.  and it becomes more worse if you enable alphatesteffect on most of the batch draw.  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.8   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - desktopgl and directx

Title_Description: moving mouse down in full screen gets crazy results. < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  i am currently writing my own map editor using monogame for two reasons.  a to master monogame and  b to preserve this map system as the programming language i originally wrote it in is hardly maintained anymore ;) ive been creating my own lay-out and stuff in it all to get the utmost out of myself.  however during test runs (in both debug and release builds) something odd happens. when i start up the app runs full screen in 1920x1080 screen mode but when i move the mouse down i suddenly get back into my windows screens but my application doesnt close however when i click the icon again on the task bar i get back into my editor but now in 720x576 screen mode.   now the source code can be found [here]( but if you need specific parts of the code just tell me.    < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - all i can find in version check is runtime version v4.0.30319    what operating system are you using - windows 10   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - desktopgl

Title_Description: content.load<song() tries to load ogg on windows project < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from     github issues are only for bug reports / feature requests  if you have a question ask it on the community site   --  < -- write your issue below --  hello monogame community. first of all i dont know exacly if it is a bug or not. for me it looks more like the way vs compiler handles and builds the assemblies or maybe i have done something wrong. for this i have decided to write this issue to warn the others about this problem and even learn something new.  ive reproduced it on the current build (3.8.0.1641) and havent tested the same thing on previous ones.  my solution is designed like this  project 1 - game project <- all contents are here. content.load<song() is also called in this project. project 2 - library project  where game contains a reference for the library project and both contains a reference for monogame assemblies. initially i was testing my games performance on desktopgl and then i have decided to compare it on windowsdx. i have updated the game project reference to windowsdx but i forgot to update the librarys reference to windowsdx. and that was my mistake. for my surprise the game projects content.load<song was using its desktopgl version and was attempting to open songs as ogg instead windowsdxs wma.  i believe the exception is well know here system.io.invaliddataexception could not determine container type .  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.8.0.1641   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - windowsdx
Name: unknown

Title_Description: glitches when starting mgcb from vs2019 < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from     github issues are only for bug reports / feature requests  if you have a question ask it on the community site   --  < -- write your issue below --  after installing monogame 3.8 when i created an empty game project on windowsdx (or desktopgl)  i found out that i saw a yellow caution mark on the package dependencies and it seems the package is not installed correctly.  those packages are two of the following  monogame.content.buider.task (3.8.0.1641)  monogame.framework.windowsdx (3.8.0.1641)  the cases ive encountered seem to be rare and most people seem to be working correctly and i didnt find anyone writing about the same problem. i checked the activity log for error output. when running mgcb i got the error “the monogame content tools only work on a 64-bit os.” but my os is windows 10 pro (64bit). i thought dotnet.exe was suspicious and looked at my path and found it in c\program files (x86)\dotnet. i removed that directory from my path and made sure my path was in the 64bit dotnet.exe file and then i found the created when i opened the project i was able to build it with no errors   i would like to see a fix so that when vs2019 starts mgcb via dotnet.exe the 64-bit version of dotnet.exe does start correctly and no cause problems.  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.8   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - windowsdx - desktopgl
Name: unknown

Title_Description: textures should always be assigned to device even if they are null im not sure if im right about this which is why im creating an issue not a pull request. if it is indeed a bug then i can create a pull request.it seems to me that this line is wrongi think we should remove the null check and always set the texture even if it is null.for example if the previously bound texture is a texturecube (well texture2d array in direct3d 11 terminology) and the new texture is a texture2d but it just happens to be null then its still necessary to set that texture slot to null otherwise direct3d will complain that the currently bound texture has the wrong dimension for the current shader. (i have this exact situation which is how i found this.)
Name: unknown

Title_Description: mouse position bug under high dpi on windows my fps camera code that constantly resets the mouse position to the centre of the window worked in xna but doesnt (quite) work in monogame. it _sometimes_ works but other times if you leave the mouse stationary it still thinks the mouse is moving by 1 pixel in the x or y direction.ive tracked the problem down to dpi scaling. if i set my dpi scaling to 100  theres no problem. but with 150  scaling there seems to be a problem with mouse position getting rounded. i havent looked into it yet but i guess that somewhere between setting the mouse position and retrieving it theres a float getting rounded to an int or something which means monogame constantly thinks that the mouse has moved by a little bit even if it hasnt.ill work on a pull request for this but i wanted to raise this issue first in case anyone else has experienced this issue. do any monogame developers have dpi scaling enabled on their monitors?

Title_Description: [solution]monogame psm not rendering texture i decided to give a try to the psm part and when i tryed to draw simple texture i ended up with null pointer exception it turns out that inside spritebatcher method drawvertexarray i had to add the following code in order to work  if(effect == null) {  var vertexcount = end - start;            _device._graphics.drawarrays(drawmode.triangles start / 2 \  3 vertexcount / 2 \  3);} else { var passes = effect.currenttechnique.passes;            foreach (var pass in passes)            {                pass.apply();                _device._graphics.drawarrays(drawmode.triangles start / 2 \  3 vertexcount / 2 \  3);            }}i hope that can help someone )
Name: unknown

Title_Description: spritebatch any changes 3.2 to 3.3? as i tried to update to monogame 3.3 i encountered some strange behavior. im really unsure if this is a bug or me misusing something but since it worked fine under 3.2 and fails in 3.3 now... my guess would be some different handling within the spritebatch class but i have no idea of the actual framework code at all.first of all im using the advanced zima 2d shadows (monogame version) compiled with the 3.3 pipeline tool on windows and using the 3.2 assemblies of monogame (in my actual game) everything just worked fine [tm_shader_working](now i switched to the 3.3 assemblies and got this result (without any other changes) [tm_shader_failing](after some research i could narrow down the problem to a 2x multi blend shader that doesnt seem to do its job anymore. [tm_shader_failinginfo](as you can see the lightmap is still being created correctly but the blending part just blackens everything out (i used my main spritebatch to simply draw the lightmap instead of blending it with the underlying texture as done in the first picture). in the actual code there is a separate spritebatch set to use the multi blend shader to draw both textures.note the rocks around the player/placeholder changed since i restarted/rebuilt the game each time and therefore the map was randomly rebuilt each time.since im quite confused now whether its my bad or not i couldnt help myself besides posting this as an issue here. i am working on a linux platform and even tried the wingl assembly but i still got this (unwanted) result.the c code where this issue occurs looks like this (completly from the shading system mentioned above)sorry if this is my issue and not yours but i dont quite understand shaders yet and i didnt make any changes except the assembly-version i use (both are marked as 3.1.2.0 though).oh while writing this i remembered the old assembly was not the official 3.2 one. it was the one from the monodevelop alpha add-in package (.mpack) that  cra0zy (or however his name is spelled sorry) posted. im unsure which version this actually is since they are all marked as 3.1.2.0...
Name: unknown

Title_Description: consider implementing / exposing texture arrays in direct3d theres an arraysize property for textures which i think would be really useful to exposeopengl has [array textures]( which look like the same thing (although not supported by opengl es 2.0).i think this could be a backwards-compatible change if you want to setdata on one of these youd use the level parameter. youd calculate the value for the level parameter using something similar to direct3ds [d3d11calcsubresource]( which wed need to expose as a new api.if this looks like something that would be of interest then id be happy to work on a pr. i just wanted to first see if it matches mgs goals.(my use-case for cascaded shadow maps its nice to use a texture2d array. the alternative is to use a single texture containing all the shadow maps with offsets to sample from the correct cascade. its certainly do-able without texture arrays but more elegant with them.)

Title_Description: .net native content pipeline issue ive been having issues for months now getting the content to build in my windows 10 universal project using the .net native toolchain. i recently started a thread on the forums herei finally tracked the issue down to this line of code it looks like its trying to filter out properties on the object that have been hidden using the new keyword in c. unfortunately the trick of checking if the getmethods for the properties are reference equal doesnt seem to work using the .net native toolchain. in general this doesn’t feel like a great way to make this check. the result is that most custom content loads up with blank or null values which causes crashes elsewhere. for my game i just commented out that line and everything works fine. i dont do any property hiding although im not sure if things would break outright even if i did. regardless i spent some time investigating fixes to the problem and it turns out .net doesnt really have a great way to determine if one property is hiding another in a base class. especially in the rt environment where reflection is limited. if possible it seems like it might be best to not do this check at all. i’m not sure what if anything was actually breaking downstream before this check existed. like i said my project works fine without it. to find out why this code exists in the first place i tried to track down the original commit but havent had much luck. i think there have been some git history rewrite shenanigans going on. you can see that in this commit ( the logic was moved from reflectivereader.cs to contentextensions.cs. but if you go through the history of reflectivereader.cs you wont see that commit. also i cant find any trace of the property hiding check ever having been in that file. instead you can see the changed seems to have happened between this commit ( and this commit (tldr; the check for property hiding is sketchball and breaks .net native apps. .net doesn’t provide a great way to check for this at all. maybe you should kill it altogether. ps the getallproperties() and getallfields() functions are misnamed. they both get very restrictive sets of properties/fields.

Title_Description: externalreference issue when loading fbx to test 4875 i wanted to try the [instancedmodel sample]( but i ran into some issues importing a .fbx model. - first there was a problem in the contentwriter about writing a non-.xnb file. this was caused by [effectmaterialcontent.effect]( being serialized since its an external reference to a non-xnb file. this was an easy fix i solved it by adding [contentserializerignore] above it. - second there was an error thrown [here]( because the filename of the reference did not begin with the root directory which was caused by [normalizeos]( in externalreference since it changed directory separators in the externalreference so the strings didnt match up. also an easy fix  i changed that so it does a regular normalize rather than normalizeos (do the separators really matter as long as theyre consistent? normalizeos is now not used anymore).- after that it built fine  however when loading the model it cant find the content reader for externalreference<compiledeffectcontent. this is the hard one p after digging through the code a bit i think it should resolve to a regular externalreferencereader so it can load the file thats referenced (the reader for the effect itself is loaded so that would work) but i got a bit confused when i saw the content readers include        it seems weird to have a reader for a specific generic type like that i thought a generic reader should read its content and delegate to the reader that can handle it. in this case i would expect a namedvaluedictionaryreader an externalreferencereader and a texturecontentreader to handle a type like this each delegating internally to the next. so my question is if i should make the writer when asked for the runtime reader write out the full name of the type (e.g. externalreferencereader1[[sometype]]) or make [contenttypereadermanager.gettypereader]( a bit smarter to use a reader for the outer type when it encounters generics. i really wouldnt go for the first option but i dont know if the second one is applicable in general (for all generic types). i think we could make it work though and it would be   a lot   neater.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: move away from xna? since monogame calles itself the _spiritual successor to xna_ and not _a mono-compatible re-implementation of xna_ i was wondering if there any plans to move away from the current api design  to get monogame ready for future requirements improve components etc. essentially making it xna-incompatible?amongst the things which are annoying me since the early days of xna (and now monogame) for example is the game class the _two-step-initialization_ paradigm and the references to game all over the place. its just bad design. also that many components which would be helpful to re-create an own better main game class are internal (e.g. gameplatform).take this for examplewhat happens here? the graphicsdevicemanager takes the current game instance as a parameter which is essentially used to register itself in the game service collection of the game only to be retrieved in a service-locating manner later from the game. this makes it not only impossible to properly test the graphicsdevicemanager it also isnt really obvious that the game requires an instance of the type (otherwise it crashes). not very nice.i know its not you guys fault its just how xna was designed. hence im asking - are there any plans to drop the design alltogether in favor of modern standards extensibility and more cleaner seperation of components?

Title_Description: leveraging c 7.2 reference semantics with value types in future? based on my shallow understanding it should be a good little performance booster? i was wondering if its worth tracking this for some 4.x+ release. obviously it would limit code to c 7.2+ compilers.     an advantage to using value types is that they often avoid heap allocations. the corresponding disadvantage is that they are copied by value. this tradeoff makes it harder to optimize algorithms that operate on large amounts of data. new language features in c 7.2 provide mechanisms that enable pass-by-reference semantics with value types. if you use these features wisely you can minimize both allocations and copy operations. this article explores those new features.   these enhancements to the c language are designed for performance critical algorithms where memory allocations can be critical to achieving the necessary performance. you may find that you dont often use these features in the code you write.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: lack of openal dlls shouldnt be fatal. i dont want to use openal audio at all so i dont think i should be required to distribute the libraries related to it.  it would be better to make me choose whether i want to initialize the monogame audio (and load the libs) or not. its done in the runtime anyway so this functionality should be easy to add (e.g. static game.initializeaudio = false; before creating the game instance) especially that my use case isnt really isolated. i believe that many gamedevs choose fmod or wwise over solutions native to engines/frameworks simply because their sound designers are used to these tools.  i get that it might be a minor issue to most people but theres no need to be forced to distribute two audio frameworks simultaneously (which is one of many reasons i dont really like unity) and it seems to be easy to avoid in case of monogame. give us more freedom )
Name: audio| feature request

Title_Description: sdlgamewindow.handle returns sdl handle instead of win32 handle as expected in xna as well as in the [winformsgameform]( [gamewindow.handle]( returns the win32-handle of the window.  that can be cast to a system.windows.forms.control (of course thats impossible as we dont use winforms) but also passed to win32-apis such as showwindow(intptr hwnd int ncmdshow) in user32.dll or the linux equivalents.  however at the moment it [returns the sdl-handle]( which is quite useless at first glance since one can only pass it to sdl-functions.   those sdl-functions cant be used since the [sdl interface is not exposed](   proposal  - change sdlgamewindow.handle to return a win32-handle by expected. this can be retrieved using [sdl_getwindowwminfo]( and create an explicit property sdlgamewindow.sdlhandle where the old _handle will be returned. problem sdlgamewindow is (of course) marked internal so a user wouldnt be able to access it without reflection.  - give users a way to call sdl-functions such as [sdl.show()]( so we one can use this property with copying the sdl2.cs to the game-project.  in my opionion a mix of these approaches would be best (expose the sdl2-interface somehow  and  add the extra sdlhandle-property).  just for reference
Name: unknown

Title_Description: monogame.utilitiess operations.malloc is not threadsafe and so texture2d.fromstream isnt been suffering from random failures to load pictures into textures which ultimately were tracked down to exceptions while trying to index the dictionary used by operations.malloc.  on inspecting  it became clear that there isnt any protection against concurrent writes to the dictionary tracking allocations and so this method would be unsafe to call from multiple threads at once but texture2d.fromstream assumes that the image loading can be done from any thread and doesnt dispatch to the ui thread until actually creating the texture leading to multiple calls into malloc at once during texture loading. as a temporary fix ive modified my fork to do the image loading on the ui thread too- this is not ideal but prevents crashes.  replication is somewhat difficult- you have to spawn multiple threads and try to load textures on them and sometimes it will crash. i could put together a sample project if needed although i think the problem is fairly visible to inspection- theres an object called _lock in operations.cs but nothing ever uses it and in the absence of any locking concurrent writes to a dictionary are incorrect.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: andoid refusing to load png in texture2d < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  issue 651 sounds like the same problem but that ticket was closed. im using monogame 3.7.1.189 (nuget package).  i get the following error system.invalidoperationexception this image format is not supported occurred  let me explain a little deeper.   using (var mem = new memorystream(rawpng))             {                 this.texture1 = texture2d.fromstream(this.graphicsdevice mem);             }  ive tried to isolate the issue as much as possible to the point where ive a byte[] in source code and are trying to load that.  in fact ive multiple files in source   theres one i call ordained by god because it is blessed with the power to load and work   yes a png that loads   all the other pngs i have are variations.  ive tried saving a png from cosmigos promotion (the working file and also failing files) as well as loading the failing png into gimp and re-saving as a png again.  ive tried re-saving as a 24bit file too.  ive even resorted to try saving the png from microsoft paint - and they all generate pngs that work in windows but under android they all refuse to load except the one ordained by god.  (bub and bob from bubblebobble as it happens).  lastly out of desperation i also tried generating a 300k byte[] thats a bmp file not png. i thought that might work - but it didnt.   im happy to share my isolated project. [spritebatchtexturesdemo.zip](  pretty please id love to get to the bottom of this one. is there something i need to know or are missing?  at the top of the game1.cs file ive a region    region data to convert back into a byte[] to load into a texture2d.   in which you can comment out the binaries you are not concerned with. note that the first one (bub n bob) actually works   were trying to establish why the others dont.    < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7.1.189   what operating system are you using - windows 10   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - android

Title_Description: exposing the drawinstancedprimitives() instance base index < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  does anyone have any objections to exposing (as an optional parameter) the instance base index in the call  drawinstancedprimitives(primitivetype primitivetype int basevertex int startindex int primitivecount int instancecount)  currently the instance base index is hardcoded to 0 inside of the private method platformdrawinstancedprimitives.  my proposal is to modify drawinstancedprimitives to have the following signature  drawinstancedprimitives(primitivetype primitivetype int basevertex int startindex int primitivecount int instancecount int instanceindex = 0)  this will preserve existing usage and behavior but allow you to optionally set a different base index for the instances.  reason being is that i have a circular buffer of instance data and i want to draw different sections of it without having to also have separate and multiple setdata calls. with this change i can set the data once and have separate draw calls drawing from different sections of the set instance data.  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - all   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - desktopgl windowsdx
Name: design

Title_Description: please add indexed texture support. please add support for the following texture formats and a why to draw them and edit their  palette data - black and white - indexed 1bpp - indexed 2bpp - indexed 4bpp - indexed 8bpp   reasons why this should be added - proper indexed textures are hard to support through shaders in a way they can be properly loaded saved and edited from one format to another. - visual studio supports these image formats in the ide proving that they can be made on newer   hardware  - these can be used to easily create retro style games in which are still quite popular. - this would make monogame stand out from other game engines  current specs - monogame 3.7 - windows 7 64 bit home - monogame desktopgl

Title_Description: spritefont proposed change to cut out the middle man. currently sprite font has 2 ways to get at the glyphs and both are round about functionally or optimally.  getglyphs() which returns a dictionary but its useless unless you cache that or you will get tons of garbage.   caching it isnt a real option because spritebatch drawstring cant use your cached dictionary. spritefont is also sealed so you cant just encapsulate it if you want to add functionality to your own custom methods.   then   there is glyphs[] which is readonly and thats fine but whats not fine is that it is an array instead of a dictionary which is like ok... now you can direct access it but its now the wrong type.  with a fat ugly slow method to search for a glyph actually being in the array that is executed in the inner loop of each drawstring. instead of a dictionary and direct access to it.  further this call is not accessible   internal int getglyphindexordefault(char c)   which sort of makes getting a array even more pointless because the user cant use pointers to access the underlying calls himself from his project. in order to duplicate any speed mitigation the pointer method might give to make up for not having a dictionary.  so in other words whats going on fundamentally is two different ideas are in play and both have the opposite problem and both are basically just acting as middle men (frustration) to what really should be the correct answer to getting at the glyphs.    public dictionary glyphs;   // or even read only doesnt matter    what is needed is glyphs to be a dictionary and direct access to it     (read the very bottom for why its both a speed hit and flexibility problem for extending functionality the way it is now.)  but.. since its not  and changing it now   would break it  .  i would like to make the suggestion that one of the two non breaking changes be made to the spritefont class or the better breaking change be made.    1)   (the superior breaking change)  make glyphs a public dictionary and readonly if necessary  set it in the constructor using getglyphs()  removing that huge ugly indexing method that checks for a key. replacing it with containskey.   this would effect all the lines from 263 to 314 essentially removing all but  a couple of them and replacing code in the method getglyphorindex(char c) with something like akin to this.    in the constructor glyphs = getglyphs();  at the end to set it; in the class declaration as dictionary<char glyphglyphs; // readonly if requisite    2)   (the inferior change) same as the above but make it a addition to the class. leaving the list in also. then the same steps as discussed above just name it something else.  glyphsdictionary or something. thats double the memory for the glyphs struct as its two copys still better then the list. you can still eliminate all that indexing code. ... i would never use the list version given the choice it is inferior and can cause real slow downs when writing a lot of text and it gets much worse as the font size increases comparatively.    3)   (the semi inferior or possibly the most inferior change)  unmark the spritefont class as a final class. public class spritefont{  . this option could be slightly better then (2) as one can possibly just new over the class. essentially mock it up on load to do (1) in roundabout way im not 100  this is possible though.  or  you can encapsulate spritefont and wrap the load method and every font that comes in as well as include the additional required dictionary. this is a lot of work that will need repeated in each project and then monogame wont really be changed for it. this will only work on a users custom methods but at least it wont roadblock you at every turn.   its always been a annoyance every time i write a method or mess with anything that has to do with text and the spritefont class. well today i was streamlining old methods so i dont have to cache and found it is basically impossible to get around this without deoptimizing spritebatch or caching via a wrapper... and a wrapper wouldnt be the right thing to do. encapsulating it would be but the damn class is marked final probably for like a .01  speed boost. which wont mean anything at all if i have to use a array and search that array were i should have a way to directly search a dictionary in the spritefont.  just in case anyone doesnt get what im saying a huge font with thousands of characters having to search in a loop that draws those characters on each iteration a character array with thousands of indices takes a shitload longer then just a few hops thru a dictionary and the more characters the worse the situation gets its basically a n 2 situation - random   n  vs a dictionary which is basically linear like a  log(n) or something basically some linear value   n in time basically its way way less looping the bigger the character array gets.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: possible opengl depth range / clipping bug its very possible that im missing something obvious.but it seems to me that monogame does not account for the difference in ndc space between direct3d and opengl.in direct3d the z-coordinate in ndc ranges from 0 to 1 while in opengl it ranges from -1 to 1. so in direct3d anything in ndc space with z < 0 will be clipped while in opengl anything in ndc space with z < -1 will be clipped.the matrix.createorthographic  and matrix.createperspective methods use direct3d conventions so the ndc depth range created by these methods is from 0 to 1.as far as i can see that means that monogames opengl renderer only ever uses half of the available depth range. worse near plane clipping doesnt work properly because objects that _should_ be behind the near clip plane and therefore clipped in fact arent because the near clip plane ends up (potentially) behind the camera. (thats how i noticed this bug - something that should have been clipped wasnt being clipped.)the only mention i can find of this issue is over on fna here flibitijibibo/fna282.  flibitijibibo mentioned a possible solution glclipcontrol and implemented it for fna [here]( but its only available in recent versions of opengl. you can also modify the matrix methods that create projection matrices but obviously thats not a general solution.  flibitijibibo has also added a note to the fna docs about the issue [here](but i feel like i must be missing something because surely this would have been noticed before now?_(note monogame uses posfixup to account for the difference between direct3d and opengl in the 0 location for the screen-space y-coordinate. thats related to this but it doesnt solve the ndc z-coordinate problem.)_
Name: unknown

Title_Description: massive wait between draw calls here is what i did i got the latest stable release of mono game.i then created a basic window project.  all i changed from the base project is thisthe only other thing is that i declared the stopwatch.so what happens here is that the program runs and fps remain high but every once in a while it will take 100+ms to call draw.this is a massive pause in drawing.  the fps remain at close to 60fps because it seems that the machine makes up for the loss by bunching more frames together.i also tried the exact same thing with the stopwatch in update and the same thing happens there too.  this is not good at all for a game as it does cause large gaps in time where things glitch and look terrible.

Title_Description: official repo for monogame extensions ? some people are conservative and dont like new classes or method etc.. but some peoples do not. the good examples of thing to be implemented are primitivebatchcircleanimation classes for skinned modelbumpmapeffect. i agreed there is too much things for single framework library - so a good variant is to create separate repo for all extensions.here is few notes... i suggest1) (most important)link it with the official website of monogame and mark it visible(it must be official repo by monogame creators otherwise nobody cares about it).2) it must work on all platforms3) it must be easy to install and use.4) no extension methods(because it is messy and could conflicts with other libs). use static classes with ex ending.5) (maybe)divide it on separate assemblies(for peoples who does not need full functionality).the main problem could be less developer activity and error checking for the first time. but i think the benefits of this repo will be huge(raw monogame couldnt do so much from a box) in the future.ps. i heard either  dellis1972 or  konajugames saying they have some sort of repo - but this is not be completed without regard of 1) rule.share your ideas )

Title_Description: rendertarget2d throws sharpdxexception when width and/or height is great enough after switching from the stable 3.5 release to the latest development build of monogame i ran into a few problems. one of them has been resolved already another has an open issue 4740 and the last is this.in my game in order to avoid drawing a lot of tiles at once which was eating up cpu i set it up so that the tiles are drawn to a rendertarget2d and the rendertarget2d itself is drawn instead and only updated as needed when tiles are added or removed. i initialized the rendertarget2d something like thisblocks = new rendertarget2d(graphics.graphicsdevice 10000 10000);with 3.5 this works fine. but with the latest build it throws a sharpdxexception with the following information (i edited out the irrelevant parts of the stack trace) sharpdx.sharpdxexception was unhandled   hresult=-2147024809   message=hresult [0x80070057] module [general] apicode [e_invalidarg/invalid arguments] message the parameter is incorrect.    source=sharpdx   stacktrace        at sharpdx.result.checkerror()        at sharpdx.direct3d11.device.createtexture2d(texture2ddescription  descref databox[] initialdataref texture2d texture2dout)        at microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.texture2d.createtexture()        at microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.rendertarget2d.generateifrequired()   innerexception further experimentation showed that the exception is directly related to the size of the rendertarget2d being initialized. constructing it at a much smaller width and height works fine. i did some testing and found the point where the exception is thrown.this constructor works fine.blocks = new rendertarget2d(graphics.graphicsdevice 4096 4096);this constructor throws the exception.blocks = new rendertarget2d(graphics.graphicsdevice 4097 4096);4096 is a very binary number... that doesnt seem like a coincidence. is this a bug or a correct limit to the size of a rendertarget2d?

Title_Description: 2mgfx warnings optimizations and constantbuffer   platform   opengl  version   latest commit and release 3.5.1  issue   destination offset is wrong count is wrong  reproducing   this is a ~very~ specific case-scenario but it can happen easily and theres no clear explanation of whats happening.if you declare a float4x4 in your code and only use it to get a float3 result it will become a float4x3 with a warning ( implicit truncation of vector type ).issue is now we dont have enough space to store float4x4 data (64 bytes) only 48 bytes.example of the problemthis will build correctly though 2mgfx on opengl but with a warning. when you apply the pass the data wont be able to be copied.  solution   1. change float4x4 to float4x3 on everything that you wont need a float4 result.or2. change implicit truncation of vector type from a warning to an error.though its a simple mistake i think this can be a block to newcomers (riemers.net tutorials wouldnt work for example which is pretty much how i started learning hlsl).
Name: unknown

Title_Description: add ieffect interface so alternative implementations of effect can be used im currently working on implementing a render batching pipeline for 3d rendering in protogame and i need some way of imitiating the effect class without actually having the costs associated with it.  the current render context in the engine has an effect property with the effect type on it.in particular a lot of the code currently looks likewhich internally then calls rendercontext.effect or whatever.id like to be able to have a fake effect one that the render batcher can provide which tracks all of the state changes made to the effect and its parameters (like setting of textures and other values) as the games render loop runs.once the render loop is about to finish the render batcher would then look at all of the render requests that came through sort them based on the most optimal way to run them (i.e. group requests where the effect and effect parameters are the same) and then push them to the gpu reducing the number of draw calls to make.  i want to basically take the game render loop which may render a whole bunch of different things with different effects and combine them together into very few draw calls potentially also making use of drawinstancedprimitives to reduce it even further.however so much of the code is coupled to the effect api and because this is a concrete class it makes it hard to use the api without incurring associated costs or without the render batching having to clone the effect and its parameters on every request (itself an expensive operation).i cant just switch out effect with some other common api either because it implements no interfaces and i want render batching to be optional; if you dont want to use render batching you shouldnt have to so its important that the effect setup can actually be a real effect when needed and not a fake effect supplied by the render batcher for the purposes of tracking changes.my proposal is to add an ieffect interface and potentially an ieffectparameter interface where their signatures would match the current public apis of the effect and effectparameter classes.  this would allow me to transparently replace effect with a fake tracking version as needed.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: track dynamicsoundeffectinstances so they can be disposed for   xaudio   when there are voices that are not yet disposed when [mastervoice is disposed]( a crash will occur as noted in [soundeffect.shutdown]( this caused our unit tests to fail in 5042. we currently have [soundeffectinstancepool]( to manage all soundeffectinstances (and dispose of them in the shutdown method) and [dynamicsoundeffectinstancemanager]( to manage   playing   dynamicsoundeffectinstances but not ones that are not currently playing. i suggest we let the dseimanager handle this by having it keep a weakreference to all instances that are not playing as well.

Title_Description: wrong usage of weakreferences in dynamicsoundeffectinstancemanager i already commented this in the commit but seems to be ignored or something.in dynamicsoundeffectinstancemanager.updateplayinginstances() is an iteration over all playinginstances with a check of isalive and getting the target of a weakreference. this can generate in very rare cases nullreferenceexceptions because the gc removes the instance between these lines of code.the check should - like in all other cases of weak references i found in the source code - check target directly to null.

Title_Description: calling convention incorrect for effectsextension in opengl (x86 windowsgl) heywhen trying to run a monogame application on the windowsgl x86 platform i get a pinvokestackimbalance on an algenfilters() call and if i continue execution i get another one on aldeletefilters() [image](i narrowed this down to the calling convention being incorrect for at least these two functions but also likely all of the ones that are dynamically added via marshal.getdelegateforfunctionpointer. the main openal functions declare their calling conventions as cdecl but those added via effectsextension() do not declare any calling convention at all.to fix this i just specified the calling convention on the delegates at openal.cs546.i dont have any other build configurations and im not sure if this is the correct way to fix it so i havent made a pull request. _likely also need to do this with the effect api above too_ though my application doesnt seem to use it.

Title_Description: support for double-precision floats for games that deal with large scales double-precision (64-bit) float support is very nice to have.     many large-scale games on custom engines use double such as minecraft star citizen elite dangerous space engineers grand theft auto the unigine game engine and likely many many more.     few game engines currently support double for legacy reasons back when cpus werent able to calculate double quickly however modern fpus and simds can handle double-precision without issues. some can even use quadruple-precision at high speeds.     some large scale games like kerbal space program use double for math and convert back to float for local positioning of objects because it uses the unity game engine which uses single-precision floats. this isnt efficient or ideal is difficult to program and ends up being buggy in the end. it isnt too practical for multiplayer either.  one way of doing this is by creating an abstract type real_t instead of float which can be typedef to either float or double. this is ideal because it would allow monogame to compile with either float or double support with minimal effort. this is how godot is implementing it   it may also be worthwhile to create structs like vector3f and vector3d which are always float or double respectively so that creators of games can choose a fixed type to use with their scripting.
Name: feature request

Title_Description: custom name for content project in msbuild pipeline is not configurable in xna it is possible to rename a content project. this would place the resulting binaries in a directory with the name of your choosing. in monogame you can rename the .mgcb file or rename the directory it resides in but the msbuild system will always copy it to a directory named content in the target directory.  firstly this is a problem because it differs from xna. secondly this is a problem because you have no way to separate the target directory of multiple content projects in a single project. this can very easily lead to file name collisions.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: improve openassetimporter currently the openassetimporter is crippled to only expose features that the old xna fbximporter and ximporter supported.  so for example we only expose 4 different texture types in materialcontent    - texture (aka diffuse)   - transparency   - specular   - bump  however assimp supports like 12 different types of defined texture maps and even custom ones.  same sort of thing exists for material properties where we only expose a few... but some useful ones like istwosided is not exposed.  i think we have two paths   a) just add the extra stuff as opaquedata and not worry.  b) set a xnacompatible flag to openassetimporter when called from the fbximporter.  if you use the openassetimporter or fbximporter let me know what you think.
Name: contentpipeline| feature request

Title_Description: effectparameter names vary because of build target as mentioned in pr 6146 the name of an effectparameter may be different for opengl builds than for all others if its a texturesampler. but that is a problem as  tomspilman already mentioned since the name of a parameter should be the primary way to fetch it not the index in the effectparameter[] in the effectparametercollection.  ive prepared a github repo that should demonstrate this issue and can be a point where to start debugging. ive not added a .gitignore file so everytings in  there.   ive tested it with monogame 3.7.0.1232 monogame 3.7.0.960 monogame 3.6.0.1598 its the same everywhere.  disclaimer ) maybe im doing something wrong here. there are many ways to declare a texturesampler but i think the shader is alright. it definitely is connected to the sampler declaration since if you declare it like this sampler2d firstsampler  register(s0); it works  but you cant use the new notation to fetch texels and youre stuck with tex2d. sure is an option but the bug is there nevertheless.  btw... when passing two textures there is some odd behavior that i have documented in this repository (including images). maybe someone can take a look and decide whether its worth pursuing or not.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: proposal to switch away from conditional builds as of right now monogame uses conditional inclusion of source files to support multiple platforms. monogame.framework for exaple is compiled as a single monolithic assembly which is different for each target platform.  to help with - transitioning monogame to .net standard for cross platform logic since pcls are deprecated - targeting .net core where posible - switching to using nuget for dependencies 6144  - reducing build times - maybe even get rid of protobuild since visual studio for mac uses msbuild and msbuild itself is open source and available for linux too  i propose monogame should - have projects containing only cross platform logic which would generate .net standard assemblies - have platform specific code in separate platform specific projects which would reference the cross platform assemblies via project reference - use the bait and switch nuget pattern to have nuget and msbuild include the appropriate assemblies for the target platform when monogame is included as a dependency - use nuget packages runtime folder and runtime ids to package any os dependent assemblies monogame needs to run ([see here for details](
Name: unknown

Title_Description: opengl project switches to full screen mode when fullscreen flag is  set to off / false i am currently using mg 3.7.0.1245 (pretty recent dev build) for an opengl project on windows 10 using vs 2017.  on my laptop i am setting graphics mode 1920x1080 with fullscreen  off  (graphicsdevice.isfullscreen = false).  1920x1080 is my windows 10 /  laptop screen resolution.  i previously had no app.manifest file (the project settings had manifest set to embed manifest with default settings) however with that setting i was having issues with the dpi scaling on my laptop and the screen size / backbuffer.  without the project app.manifest setting the mode to 1920x1080 with fullscreen  off  worked fine i.e. i would get a windowed output.  however i have since created an app.manifest file which has the dpiaware = true entry. this fixes my dpi scaling problem however now when i set the mode to 1920x1080 and have fullscreen set to  off  the app still launches in fullscreen. if i change the app mode to another resolution e.g. 800x600 (which is different from my screen resolution of 1920x1080) then it displays correctly in windowed mode.  so the issue seems to be setting a mode that matches the screen resolution (in this case 1920x1080) and having dpiaware = true. when those 2 things are aligned the fullscreen flag seems to be ignored and it sets the app to fullscreen anyways.  unless i am mistaken the app should always be in windowed mode when the isfullscreen flag is set to false even if the window size matches the screen resolution.

Title_Description: remove protobuild there are so many better ways of organizing the repo without using protobuild - using shared projects - using the new csproj format + few wildcards - using the old csproj format + few wildcards  for the first pass we would just need to generate all the .csproj files this way we wont be changing anything for the build system and afterwards we could slowly do modifications over time with smaller changes.  alternatively we could make it only generate the monogame.framework and monogame.framework.net projects while everything else is made of static projects.
Name: maintenance

Title_Description: possible bug mousestate not always changing after calling mouse.setposition i need to capture the mouse cursor within games window area to prevent accidental clicks outside of it which gamers find very annoying when that happens.  unfortunately i cant find any dedicated monogames functionality for that (not letting the mouse to go outside of the game window / delta-based mouse input) so i came up with a solution involving setting the mouse position to the center of the window.  unfortunately 2 there seems to be a rare bug that causes the position reported in the mouse state to be always different than the position i set (so my cursor is always going somewhere without me even touching the mouse it resets when i move the mouse again).  my operating system is windows 10. not sure if it happened on older windows versions.  heres the screenshot from visual studio with the watches that show the values of variables used to compute the delta. ive set this up without touching the mouse not to spoil the result. the expected behavior is that the next time i hit the breakpoint the x value in the mouse state should be changed to the mousemidxs value and the deltas should be 0. it doesnt happen until i move the mouse slightly then it returns to the expected behavior. so far the bug appears to happen randomly.    im not aware of any other way to do it in monogame which is a shame because that kind of mouse control is absolutely essential for 2d aiming or fpp look.

Title_Description: discussion for removing protobuild and migrating to new(er) style csproj  tasks  i dont think we should migrate the installer. instead we should replace it with nugets (and possibly another way to distribute the pipeline tool).  to make things usable but not offer a full replacement we need to fix any failing tests for mgcb on .net core making sure its dependencies all work. other than that we just need to publish nugets - nugets for core projects - nugets for dotnet new templates - mgcb global tool nuget  we could already publish nuget 1 and 2 without fixing 3 because they use cra0zys content.builder nuget to pull in mgcb (running on .net framework).  to fully migrate we need to - distribute the pipeline tool someway - finish desktopgl videoplayer 6860 (so we can drop the mac platform) - provide a vsix that installs the dotnet new samples (mentioned in 6842)  bonus - f and vb templates - let the cake script upload develop nugets to a feed (myget or github nuget feed)  ___________  this issue is for tracking and discussing how to migrate from protobuild generated project files to sdk-style csproj files.  related - 6207 issue for removing protobuild - 6650 pr that moves source files for globbing with sdk-style csproj  we will set up pull requests separately to add the csproj for each platform.  ________________  additionally we should look at the following issues once we remove protobuild - 5339 4975 supporting .net standard will be easy - 6137 support dotnet build - 6144 switch to nugets for dependencies; this would make dependency management so much easier. we could set up a nuget feed on githubs [package registry]( on teamcity or on myget to have our custom-built stuff hosted. - 6649 can be closed when protobuild is gone - 5751 and 5192 publish development builds and pull request builds to a nuget feed.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: replace nant scripts with cake scripts cake is literally made with c project compilation in mind as such its much easier to call stuff like dotnet restore or msbuild pack without having to worry if you properly setuped the location of where the stuff is found on each platform.  cake scripts are just c scripts with some predefined methods any c function can be called from them because of this. its also much easier to read the build script logic as its just c code.    cc.  tomspilman  jjagg  dellis1972  konajugames
Name: unknown

Title_Description: [question/proposal] make discardcolor writable. is there any reason ( other than the bug patch here  ) because discardcolor is different in debug/release?  im usually working with the release version but i had to switch back to debug for some gpu leaks im searching and some of my rts became purple-tinted. right now when using mg in debug mode and release mode may give different results because of that patch. personally i think both versions should give always the same results but thats just a personal preference.  anyways i think that if theres no ulterior motive discardcolor should be writable. right now to get the same results on debug/release i have to either   clear the render target myself to black with an ifdef debug (which is ugly considering that mg should be multiplatform yet doesnt get the same results even with a debug/release change)   clear the rt to black without the ifdef (clearing twice losing performance)   use preservecontents and clear always (dangerous and prone to errors)  making discardcolor writable to your desired clear color would result in cleaner code and performant.
Name: design| good first issue

Title_Description: color.transparentblack < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- xna 3.0 had two transparent values  transparentblack   transparentwhite. when xna 4.0 switch to use premultiplied colors by default they drop both properties and replaced them with color.transparent.   mg still defines color.transparentblack which has the same value as color.transparent.  i propose to mark transparentblack as obsolete for now and then remove it on a later version.   < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7.1 3.8 (dev)   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - windowsdx windowsuwp android
Name: good first issue
