Title_Description: msbuild properties to build desktopgl for a specific platform this is a proposal to simplify publishing for desktopgl.when building a desktopgl game dependencies for mac linux and windows are included. it would be nice to have msbuild properties that users can set to remove native dependencies except for the target platform. e.g. the following properties mgtargetwin64 mgtargetwin32 mgtargetmac mgtargetlinux64 mgtargetlinux32 mgtargetwin and mgtargetlinux (last two to include both 32- and 64-bit).when publishing with dotnet cli we can check the rid (runtime identifier e.g. win-x64) to figure out what dependencies are necessary.  cc  cra0zy  mrhelmut
Name: unknown

Title_Description: joystick.getstate generates lots of garbage < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- [joystick.getstate]( allocates new arrays for each joystickstate which can lead to lots of garbage over time considering input is usually obtained multiple times a frame for controllers. i can think of a few options for improving this   add a cached default state that is simply returned when we need to return a [default joystickstate]( this avoids allocating multiple zero-length arrays.   add some type of garbage-less overload that takes in user-defined arrays to fill the information with. the user can get the joystickcapabilities first to see how many axes buttons and hats the joystick has - the existing code already does this as a matter of fact. one thing to consider would be how to cleanly present this api.   < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - develop   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - desktopgl
Name: unknown

Title_Description: pipelinecontroller catches only notsupportedexception upon initialization of encoding < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- currently pipelinecontroller upon dobuild tries to set encoding within a try/catch clause. the clause only catches notsupportedexception and initializes encoding with utf8 in case of the exception.   according to msdn encoding.getencoding may also throw argumentexception which means that provided codepage is not supported too. not catching this exception leads to the pipeline tool sometimes being unresponsive on build/rebuild/clean actions   [pipelinebug](      < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - latest develop build   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - windowsdx
Name: unknown

Title_Description: resource leak in drawablegamecomponent; unloadcontent is never called. < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  checking the code i noticed that drawablegamecomponent implements loadcontent and unloadcontent virtual methods.  - loadcontent is called from initialize(); - unloadcontent is not called from anywhere never.  i think that at the very least drawablegamecomponent should overload gamecomponent.dispose(bool disposing) and call unloadcontent.  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7.1.189   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - windowsdx

Title_Description: switching between song objects in the mediaplayer causes them to be played at a reduced volume < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- im trying to implement music in my game using the mediaplayer and song classes but im running into an issue. the first song i play will play at the desired volume no matter how many times i play it. however as soon as i try playing a different song the volume is significantly reduced even though mediaplayer.volume is still set to 1. even if i try switching back to the original song the volume is usually reduced as well. sometimes the first song will still be at the desired volume after switching back to it but this seems to occur at random and the volume reduction will eventually occur after calling play on it a few more times. the volume reduction seems to be permanent until i close out and start the game again.   i have tried both mp3 and wav files but both run into this issue. this issue does not affect the volume of soundeffect objects just song objects. i tried posting to the forums for a solution but i was told that this is probably an issue with monogame itself and that i should post about it here.  after some experimenting i found that the problem seems to be related to the contentmanager. removing all soundeffect loads from my code fixes the issue but loading even a single soundeffect using the contentmanager causes the issue to occur. im loading my soundeffect objects from mp3 files if thats important.   however this issue occurred even before adding soundeffect objects to my project so im not sure why removing them now solved the issue. anyway soundeffect objects may or may not be the only source of the issue but loading soundeffect objects is the only consistent way of reproducing the issue that ive found.  heres a simple example where the issue occurs. ive added the following code to a default windows project. pressing a or s will cause the song to play at full volume but then pressing the other button will cause the other song to play at a reduced volume       < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.8.0.626   what operating system are you using - windows 10   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - windowsdx
Name: audio

Title_Description: readrawasset for spritefont needs to be implemented i hope my conclusion of what the issue should be is correct but to be sure i will elaborate more.as i was searching how to draw strings i found a lot of old methods that have been replaced by the new monogame content pipeline now. to create a .spritefont file with the pipeline is pretty straightforward and gives no problems but then it needs to be loaded.using content.load<spritefont throws a notimplementedexception because this leads to a call to readrasasset which throws that exception when the type is spritefont (with a contruction of a spritefont in comment).if i am correct this means that there is no way to load spritefonts at the moment and as you need a spritefont to draw a string it is also impossible to draw text at the moment. thus it is important that this is implemented soon.looking at the created .spritefont file however i wonder if the spritefont class is meant to be abolished.  i thought this because it states <asset type=graphicsfontdescription leading me to think that the type is to be changed to fontdescription. this type does not exist yet however. i was not able to find anything about this possible change however.finally im sorry if i just misunderstood the way drawing strings must be done now and i simply addressed problems that are not there. i would like to hear so if this is the case however.

Title_Description: request for regular monogame windows (xaml) project template (i.e. not for windows store) this is a feature request and a request for guidance---in vs2013 there is a monogame windows store (xaml) project template which is kind of neat but its only there for windows store apps.allowing xaml in this way is very cool (especially for games or tooling that might make heavy use xaml ui elements etc.).however developing in app mode all the time is super annoying since (at least in windows 8.1) it forces you to always run full screen with a slight delay on opening the app and no easy way to close the apps (alt+f4 is about as good as it gets everything else involves mouse and its really nice while developing to just be able to press esc and exit the damn thing but you cant do it -- app.current.exit() doesnt even work anymore it just minimizes the thing).---1.) can you please make it easy (i.e. include a project template) for developing a regular windows desktop application with xaml / monogame? (i.e. monogame windows (xaml) project) -- [or otherwise if you can provide guidance and im able to figure it out i could submit a pull request...]2.) it seems this project template is missing all together in vs2015 (other project templates are there but this one is just plain missing -- might be its own issue / request but i thought id check here first).3.) is it possible to support xaml on other platforms as well (i.e. linux android etc.)?4.) also somewhat off-topic (i can log another issue etc. if you like but hopefully you can just point me  at some quick guidance here?) but the monogame slogan write once play everywhere seems to not be the default state if youre just using the out-of-the-box templates -- in the sense that i have to create a new solution for each platform i want to support. -- is there guidance on how to build a single solution with multiple projects in them that all share the same codebase? -- i thought about putting all my engine code into a portable library but it would have to reference the mono game dlls so it cant be a portable library... right? -- i suppose i could just add the same source files via add as a link in all the projects -- even then though what should i do about the content projects? --   bottom line is there official guidance here?  thank you  -)
Name: unknown

Title_Description: [windx] opening steam overlay results in stuck keys im currently working on steam integration with my game and i came across an issue when opening the steam overlay. the shift and tab keys (which you press to open the overlay) end up getting stuck in the game. im assuming this is because the steam overlay intercepts all the key events so monogame never sees the release events for these keys.im having this problem with the windx build but i imagine it also affects other desktop builds. (update this actually seems to only affect monogame directx. both xna and monogame sdl2 work correctly.)my current workaround to this issue is to clear monogames internal key buffer (i.e. keyboard._keys) whenever the steam overlay is opened or closed. however given this is not publicly exposed the only way to do this is by changing monogame to expose it or by using reflection. i am not sure if this is the best way of dealing with this but it seems to work well.has anyone else experienced this particular problem? and if so how did you solve it?and if my workaround seems reasonable would it be acceptable to add this to the monogame api (e.g. a keyboard.flush method which clears the buffer)? if so im more than happy to submit a pr.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: [windx] sharpdx unsupported exception when creating graphics device i got the below crash report a little while ago (from a windows 7 sp1 machine)the crash occurred while trying to create the graphics device. from what i can tell it seems like a driver issue (probably a fresh install of windows without video drivers being installed). unfortunately i wasnt able to contact the user who reported it (they submitted an invalid e-mail) so i couldnt investigate the cause.but i guess the main issue here is not that an exception occurred but that monogame threw a sharpdx exception when trying to create the graphics device. im not sure but i think in this case xna would likely throw a nosuitablegraphicsdeviceexception ( does anyone know more about how xna would handle this?thoughts?
Name: unknown

Title_Description: content statistics it would be very useful for the mgcb tool to gather content statistics.  the statistics would be generated when content building occurs and would be persisted to an xml file.example of statistics we could gather would be- number of models in the project.- mbs of compressed soundeffect s.- percentage of uncompressed vs compressed texture2ds.- the disk space required for all content.- the approximate memory usage in game of all content.- the amount of textures in a particular folder.these statistics then could be parsed and presented in the pipeline tool ui in some useful manner.ideally most of the information could be gathered from the builder without the help of individual processors.  types of content what folders they exist in number of files disk space required etc can be all gathered from the outside.  things like if the content is compressed or not or the runtime memory usage would require either some cooperation from the processor to work efficiently.  we could easily add additional methods to the contentprocessorcontext or the base contentitem to help record the necessary information.this feature would make diagnosing content size issues easier and more accurate than the guessing and runtime measurements we have to do now.
Name: contentpipeline| feature request| help wanted

Title_Description: disposed assets loaded through a contentmanager can never be reloaded when any resource (for example a texture2d or effect) is loaded through a contentmanager instance is then dispose()d explicitly at a later time there is no way to load this resource through the same contentmanager instance again.example codethe texture resource _test_ in this example can never be loaded through the same contentmanager again because it has been disposed and the contentmanager keeps a record of all resources loaded which makes it return the same disposed resource instance.i have tested this and it works the same way with xna but i am wondering if this is intended behavior with disposed resources because besides creating a new contentmanager instance i dont see a way of loading a disposed resource at a later time.and to do this i need to keep a record of disposed resources per contentmanager myself to predict when i need a new contentmanager just to load a disposed resource.my opinion on this is that when i call load<t i do not expect it to return an already disposed resource even if i disposed this resource earlier as there is no way to remove this disposed resource instance from the internal contentmanager record.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: missing graphicsdevice.blendfactor xna has a [blendfactor]( property in graphicsdevice that is currently missing in monogame. note that there is also a [blendfactor]( property variable in blendstate. i wrote a quick test to see how it works in xnathis passes so to get the same behavior in mg we just need to add a public color blendfactor { get; set; } and then in the blendstate setter set blendfactor = value.blendfactor. i dont know if this property should just override the blendfactor from the blendstate but my guess is thats how it works. xna docs are ambiguous on this and just say both control blend factor...

Title_Description: mgcb doesnt clean empty project this is a minor issue... but one we probably should support correctly.   - create a new empty pipeline project.  - add one content item to it.  - build the content.  - undo adding the content item leaving an empty project.  - build content.  at the end you would expect the intermediate .mgcontent files and the .xnb to be cleaned but they are not and still exist.  it suggests to me mgcb.exe is taking an early out when there are no files and fails to clean the previous content.

Title_Description: toohighmultisamplecountclampedtomaxsupported fails on some machines i find on some of my machines the unit test toohighmultisamplecountclampedtomaxsupported  fails    it came from  by  jure-bb  specifically i get errors on this line   (note the assert also should be fixed as expected and actual parameters are reversed)  in my case my reference device gets 16 and not 32.  so either   a) were not setting the reference device properly.  b) reference device can have different max multisample counts on different systems.  c) some other weird bug.  someone needs to do a little research on this and fix this test.  assuming a is not true... my guess is fixing it to verify that the resulting multisamplecount is < the set value might be a more robust test and covers what were looking to verify anyway.  also ideally we could also enable it to run on opengl and xna now and not just windows dx platforms.
Name: directx| help wanted| testing

Title_Description: float textures for opengl es 3.0 monogame currently does not support surfaceformat.single for gl es 3.0. i opened this issue in response to a topic on the forums   in opengl es 2.0 float textures are supported through the [oes_texture_float]( extension but only in the alpha channel. since surfaceformat.single is defined as a float in the red channel we cant support it in gl es 2.0.  in opengl es 3.0 things work just like in opengl so things should just work if mg did exactly the same thing as in desktopgl. currently an unsupportedoperationexception is thrown. the user reporting this issue in the forum topic mentioned the following line causes the exception   we should investigate where this exception is thrown so we can prevent throwing it under opengl es 3.0. the docs should mention that surfaceformat.single is not supported for opengl es 2.0.  this does raise the question if we should actually support opengl es 3.0+ only features on mobile since its not portable. in this case its zero-effort though so im all for it )
Name: feature request| help wanted

Title_Description: gamepad issues after recent windows 10 updates < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build insaller from   --  < -- write your issue bellow --  overview took a break from gamedev with a work trip a few weeks back and found that none of my home computers (all windows 10) and my 3 alpha testers (also windows 10) can use a gamepad.  tried it both on 3.6 and 3.7.  the gamepad .isconnected is true or false depending on if the controller is plugged in or not for most of the devices except the xbox one controllers no longer light up or say connected. so i can confirm that this isnt previously posted issues regarding false positives. for some controllers even emulators are able to get them.  on all listed devices however even when the gamepad class sees them as connected there is no input being read. i made a small input manager to check all the input and log them. nothing from gamepads. even doing direct gamepad state checks on all possible buttons during the update loop ive got nothing.  checking my reliability history seems that there is a new xbox controller driver install when the controller is plugged into that system for the first time. started showing up on 3/13.  i last worked 2/28 for me but i am not sure when it stopped working exactly. or if it has to do with a specific windows update. some places are showing that creators update for windows 10 is a problem. i tried getting the old drivers back which has helped some unity games but still has issues with monogame projects. all devices now show up as hid devices rather than usb devices in my device manager.  i know we cant control windows updates but this isnt the first time a windows 10 update stopped dev on all my systems input-wise. this must be the third time in the last two or three years where all of my dev machines and testers are knocked offline.  i was able to replicate this issue on older versions of monogame as well. specifically in the games axiom verge and bastion (i have yet to try newer games like pyre). unity games still seem to work but i only tried a few newer ones hand of fate 2 and enter the gungeon. < -- system stats --   peripherals - xbox one controller - xbox one elite controller - ibuffalo classic usb gamepad - steam controller - ps4 dual shock 4 - 8bitdo sf30 wireless/usb3.0 snes controller   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.6 - monogame 3.7 (development)   what operating system are you using - windows 10 (post creators update) - all machines have updated at least since march 7th   what monogame platform are you using < -- ie. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android-- - desktopgl - .net 4.7     edit/update   - after restarting my machine with the old drivers in place the xbox button lights up on plugin and is connected again so all controllers listed are connected. but none of them can read input. - edit 2 - xbox controllers now work with most aaa games (shadows of war batman arkham) and unity (battle chef brigade hand of fate 2) games. still not working with monogame based games like axiom verge  owlboy  stardew valley)
Name: help wanted

Title_Description: project templates use the same guid the project templates use a hard coded guid instead of having a new one generated each time. this can cause [problems in visual studio for mac]( when adding the same monogame project type to the same solution.  the [template.config file]( should have a guids section that lists the guids used in the templates. the templating engine will then replace these with new guids when the templates are created.     what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7.0.1   what operating system are you using - mac

Title_Description: png transparency with opengl < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build insaller from   --  < -- write your issue bellow  when using desktopgl on linux and android if you load textures from .png files (using something like texture = texture2d.fromstream(...) and the images have transparency then the transparency from these images is ignored.  using the monogame pipeline to convert these png files to xnb files solves the problem so i think the issue may be linked to the way png files are loaded from streams with opengl.  note the same png files load ok on directx projects.  some screenshots desktopgl + png  desktopgl + xnb  directx + png   < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7   what operating system are you using - linux  android   what monogame platform are you using < -- ie. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android-- - desktopgl  android    when using desktopgl on linux and android if you load textures from .png files (using something like texture = texture2d.fromstream(...) and the images have transparency then the transparency from these images is ignored.  using the monogame pipeline to convert these png files to xnb files solves the problem so i think the issue may be linked to the way png files are loaded from streams with opengl.  note the same png files load ok on directx projects.  some screenshots desktopgl + png  desktopgl + xnb  directx + png

Title_Description: uwp xamlgame<t construction < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  hi   id like to discuss another possible way to initialize a game object for a xaml uwp application.  now there is a static initializer monogame.framework.xamlgame<t.create(...) that takes care of the construction of the game class. with this logic it isnt possible to inject in a clear way some dependencies since the default constructor is called var game = new t();.  what id like to propose as a pull request if you agree with me is - doing nothing to xamlgame<t.create(...) in avoid breaking everything and to keep projects templates as they are - add an overload to that create method that takes a gameconstructor func<t to be called like this var game = gameconstructor(); in the create method.  in that way the final user will initialize its uwp implementation of the game like this var game = monogame.framework.xamlgame<mygameclass.create(launcharguments window.current.corewindow swapchainpanel () = new mygameclass(dep1 dep2...));  _side note_ considering that the class requires the t  game to have a default constructor by adding this overload i ask anyway to mantain a default constructor although it couldnt be necessary.    why i need to inject dependencies in my game?   consider i have the same game class for different platforms. my game class needs an istringsprovider an iachievementsmanager an istoregateway i would implement those differently for each platform. to me each specific platform will have only need to construct a new game with its correct implementations. this is a real case i have game published for android and for uwp with this logic.  what do you think? (if you agree i could do the pull request) thanks.  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - windowsuwp
Name: feature request

Title_Description: mac monogame performs faster with .hardwaremodeswitch = false but scaling wrong < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  strange results are happening if i dont enable .hardwaremodeswitch on mac.  scaling is correct only if i enable hardwaremodeswitch (mouse coordinates matches spritebatch coordinates).   but if i avoid hardwaremodeswitch (set to false) the same resolution performs faster but the scaling is all out of whack -- mouse coordinates do not match spritebatch coordinates.    same buffer resolution but different pros/cons.   performance seems about 30  slower if i do a hardware mode switch on mac.  desired fix is to make sure that monogame mac mouse coordinates + sprite batch coordinates are in sync.    to verify if i did something wrong -- i checked scaling parameter variables and theres no way to detect how its scaled -- it is not an exact 21 scaling (e.g. 1280x800 - 2560x1600) but some kind of odd 1.6 or 1.7 scaling factor as if it forgot to internally update some internal variables.   i tried the matrix.createscale tricks with hardcoded values but the odd values make this hard -- theres no way to detect the correct weird scaling as all the querying/metrics say 1280x800.  the problem does not happen on a pc (coordinates stay in sync).  so there might be an internal scaling calculation issue.  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7.0.1494   what operating system are you using - mac   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - desktopgl

Title_Description: drop the installer the mg installer is causing a high maintenance burden and there are a lot of issues with it. we really dont need to have it anymore if we provide alternatives. that means  - publish development nugets to a feed. theyre published to the teamcity feed but imo we should move to github package feed or myget so the publishing of the packages can be done in the cake script and finally upgrade from nuget v1. we should also better promote the feed. - distribute templates with vsix and as dotnet new template packages (on the aforementioned nuget feed). - distribute cli tools as dotnet global tools. - distribute the pipeline tool in some way. need some discussion for this one im not sure how we best go about this. the pipeline tool can use mgcb as a dotnet global tool and will not be tied to any version. we will be able to version it separately. we should make mgcb version configurable in the pipeline tool.  cc  tomspilman  cra0zy  related 5262
Name: installer

Title_Description: [todo list] future-proofing monogame hey there   many efforts have been started to future-proof monogame and make it a modern .net framework but it seems that there is no comprehensive centralized point where to understand how things should move forward and their current state.  hence im trying to maintain this issue to keep track of the different tasks. please feel free to point me to any untracked tasks or progress.  i guess that we will agree on the following main objective   making monogame fully .net standard 2.0 compliant in its entirety   (all targets all of its tools and its build/test/package process) while maintaining a backward compatibility where its relevant.  this would mean being able to consume monogame as a  once protobuild is gone)    bonus stage for console targets (which unfortunately cant be discussed publicly)   - [x] ~keeping vs2015 and net45 non-sdk style projects while being compatible with the parent repository structure~ (deprecated) - [x] refactoring mgcb and pipeline to find console targets  - [x] enforce c 5.0 language version

Title_Description: use dotnet tools during build this is a question about the design and usage of the recent dotnet tools 2mgfx and mgcb. i havent found much discussion of this but please point me in the right direction if i missed a thread. apologies for the verbosity.   question  do we expect users to manually install dotnet tools before being able to build their game or should they get the functionality automatically from the template or a packagereference?  im under the impression that monogame is moving toward a model where a dev can clone a game repo and build without requiring any manual installation.   problem  dotnet tools seem to be intended more as manual helpers rather than for use in automated build steps for the following reasons  1. dotnet tools are not automatically restored on build. dotnet restore is run on build but still not dotnet tool restore. this means tools need to be manually and explicitly installed or restored. 2. dotnet tools cannot be transitive dependencies by design as opposed to package references.  you wont be able to reference a monogame.content.builder package that in turn references the mgcb tool. this means that any project intending to use mgcb will either need the tool installed globally or listed in a manifest for local tool restore.   solutions  given those constraints i see the following options  1. publish a monogame.content.builder package that expects the mgcb tool to be present.     - the user can then choose to install the tool globally or check in a local tool manifest and manually restore from it.     -   concern   the user must manually install or restore the tool. 2. publish a monogame.content.builder package that depends on the mgcb tool but automatically runs dotnet tool restore.     - the user can still choose to install the tool globally or check in a local tool manifest. in the case of a local manifest though it will be automatically restored as part of build. im not sure if this has perf implications or why its not already automatic.     -   concern   the repo must contain a local manifest or the user must manually install the tool. 3. keep monogame.content.builder as is.     - the package has full control over the mgcb dependency requiring no manual action.     -   concern   this is somewhat non-standard and doesnt use the dotnet tools at all.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: pipeline dotnet tool i dont believe theres been much discussion of the design of the pipeline dotnet global tool. im interested in helping with that next as i think thats the last piece that need to be nugetized.   open questions  1.   future of pipeline tool.     [edit] resolved   pipeline is here to stay while cra0zy is working on his own alternative.        jjagg i am in process of writing something custom for the content builder among the other stuff so im leaving this to you. i really dont wanna touch mgcb/pipeline tool anymore.      _originally posted by  cra0zy in       should we be expecting something to replace the current tooling or is that just personal preference or maybe an alternative option? (i assume the latter)  2.   name.     [edit] resolved   mgcb editor is currently the top contender with commands like dotnet tool run mgcb-editor      as a public package pipeline is too generic. what name should be used for the package and the command? (note our other tools are dotnet-mgcb and dotnet-2mgfx.) for example     - tool dotnet-mgpipeline     - global command mgpipeline     - local command dotnet tool run mgpipeline  3.   structure.     [edit] resolved   the platform packages cant be unified because we want native ui controls on windows. we can however package them together and have a cross-platform launcher so the experience is seamless across all platforms.      should we package platform-specific pipeline tools or unify them? is ui the only thing preventing these from being unified? presumably shaders can just continue to not compile on non-windows for now.     - platform-specific would be easiest since it would keep the same structure and eto dependencies. we can publish dotnet-mgpipeline-windows dotnet-mgpipeline-mac dotnet-mgpipeline-linux but this is clearly not ideal.     - we can switch to a new cross-platform .net core ui framework and publish a single cross-platform tool. the most popular appears to be [avalonia](     - we can use monogame.desktopgl itself for the ui -- either a 3rd party ui framework or maintain an _extremely_ slim set of controls just for the tools (not a part of the mg framework).  4.   mgcb dependency.     [edit] resolved   mgcb will be packaged directly into mgcb editor. the duplicated files arent too large and shouldnt be much concern for devs.      how should the mgcb dependency be handled?     - just package mgcb binaries into the pipeline tool as well? then users who use the pipeline tool and build with the monogame.content.builder package (6905) would have a handful of files duplicated but its not a big issue. is there a concern about the two versions needing to be manually kept in sync?     - package mgcb binaries into the pipeline tool but dont additionally required the mgcb tool when using the pipeline tool. instead use mgcb out of the pipeline tool. see the _usage_ option below for more details.     - have the pipeline tool depend on the mgcb dotnet tool. this would be difficult because if the pipeline tool is installed globally then it would have to also install the mgcb tool globally which is an option we decided to avoid with monogame.content.builder. this could also be difficult to run locally out of the monogame repo because the pipeline tool would need to be able to either depend on the mgcb dotnet tool or use the local mgcb project.  5.   usage.     [edit] resolved   /register and /unregister cli commands will be available to associate the app with the .mgcb extension by running pipeline /register (global) or dotnet tool run pipeline /register (local).      i expect a common scenario to be installing as a global tool but can we enable more options?     - as an additional option i was thinking about being able to specify an option in the monogame.content.builder package (6905) to restore the pipeline tool instead of mgcb. this would make it easier for content designers to just clone a repo and automatically get the recommended tooling. and obviously this wouldnt have to compromise any of the core monogame.content.builder functionality.     - will we need to give up associating the .mgcb file extension with the tool? this doesnt seem like a good option anymore since dotnet tools can be installed globally or locally. following the potential usage option above in my own repos i plan to change my pipeline extensions project into a netcoreapp that can simply call dotnet tool run pipeline on the correct .mgcb file.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: xact cue doppler effect is not implemented < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  i was going to use the doppler effect of moving sounds in my game using cues after spending half a day checked the code. its just not implemented ( )  so what is going on here  1. we have a distance between listener and emitter now in relative units say meters. 2. we calculate distance between them in next second after velocity was applied. 3. so we get relative velocity in meters per second by (1st - 2nd distance). 4. this relative velocity is actually used as v in the doppler equation   [doppler equation](   where c is the speed of sound in environment w0 is original frequency and w is final frequency. i was implemented it by russian wiki ( seems there is the same formula in english wiki but looking different. 5. this multiplier of w0 and the dopplerpitchscalar variable for xact are the same  [xact rpc]( just found it empirically and it worked but cant be fully sure. can you guys implement it correctly ? thanks    < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7.1   what operating system are you using - windows 10   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - desktopdx
Name: audio

Title_Description: android support immersivesticky system_ui_flag_immersive_sticky was added in android 4.4 it allows apps to take over the whole screen and hide the soft keys.ref you can enable this in your android app using thisbut if you do it with monogame you end up with your game still rendering at the non full screen size with gaps above and below (filled with the cleard color).ive done a bit of searching it looks like we need to probably use the sizes that get passed in to onsurfacechanged rather than the ones we fetch in androidgamewindow.initializeim not sure exactly how we should touch the rest of the system to make it work best.im thinking if the user sets graphicsdevicemanager.isfullscreen = true; then we should try set immersivesticky.then we can update graphicsdevicemanager.resetclientbounds to update preferredbackbufferwidth/height based on what we receive in onsurfacechanged.thoughts?has anyone else tackled this yet?

Title_Description: draw timing issue when nvidia 3d vision is activated - workaround included  introductionfirst of all i want to point out that this issue may be more important than you may think at first because it may happen in every monogame even if its pure 2d. even worse a usual player that owns 3d vision may not even have the idea that the graphic glitches he is seeing may be related to 3d vision he forgot to deactivate. symptomsso now for the issue itself. after experiencing random graphic glitches i wrote a sample code as simple as possible (see below). in order to run it you will need1. a new plain windows desktop monogame project2. a resource file named pixel.xnb which is a 2d-texture that simply contains a single black pixel.what it does is to draw a horizontal black line with a height of 5 pixels on a white background and move it vertical in steps of 5 pixels every frame. works perfectly with 3d vision deactivated but if 3d vision kicks in the following happens [timingglitch](it turned out that it was impossible to get a regular screenshot from the glitch so i needed to take a photograph of my screen. so please ignore the unsharp grey stripes - they are a side-effect of taking a photograph of the screen and not really there. what is the real glitch are the 3 thin horizontal lines there only should be one which is the lowest of them.if you could see the movement the glitch lines appear to be flickering (i think about 20 times/second see my theory below). but taking a video of the glitch is even more impossible (120 hz video camera anyone? d ). then the glitch lines change their position at random points of time.looking through my 3d glasses it appeared that the glitch lines are only in the half-picture intended for the right eye the left eye looks normal. theory after some research about the internal workings of directx graphics and how monogame uses it i came up with the following theory how this happens1. monogame creates a swapchain in the video memory which consists of a screen buffer and 2 back buffers2. since 3d vision needs 2 half-pictures it creates secondary buffers for the right eye. it doesnt tell the application anything about that (wouldnt be possible with older 3d games that are automatically converted into stereo 3d)3. when a frame should be drawn monogame sends draw instructions to the graphics card and waits until they are executed then presents the next buffer in the swapchain.4. monogame (or sharpdx?) uses some unusual way to determine when the draw operations are finished. at least i assume it must be unusual since i never noticed the same problem in other 3d games. the call returns when the first buffer has been drawn the secondary buffer has not yet been drawn.5. under normal circumstances the next frame is drawn now. if that happens the preceding draw operations are cancelled. the secondary buffer remains unchanged.6. only at random times (for example when the operating system gives cpu time to another thread or process) the graphics card is given enough time to execute the drawing operations for the seondary buffer. then the secondary buffer is changed.7. the screen is presented with the contents of the primary and secondary buffers. since the secondary buffer contains an old version of the drawing from some random point of time in the past a flickering ghost will appear. since there are 3 secondary buffers it flickers at a rate of      120 hz / 2 (half pictures/second) / 3 (buffers/half-picture) = 20 hz      there are up to 3 ghosts because we have 3 secondary buffers. workaroundto test my theory i just gave the graphics card more time to finish by adding a thread.sleep() to the draw cycle. to test remove the slashes from the line thread.sleep( (int)gametime.elapsedgametime.totalmilliseconds/8); in my code sample. i found the appropriate amount of time with trial and error it may be system dependent.on my system this removes all the graphic glitches. suggestions for solutionthe second best solution would be to deactivate 3d vision in monogame completely. there is an api (nvapi.dll) that allows game developers to control 3d vision so monogame would need to check wether it is present and make the appropriate calls.the best solution would be of course to fix the source of the problem since this would allow to write 3d-vision compatible games with monogame. code
Name: unknown

Title_Description: sound effects no longer work under windows 7 (directx) pr 4010 has caused a regression - sound effects no longer work under windows 7 (for the directx build).further investigation reveals that soundeffect(.xaudio).initializesoundeffect was swallowing an exception about being unable to load xaudio2_8.dll. i found a post on the sharpdx forums discussing this issue ( long story short - it seems you need to use the directx11 sharpdx libraries for windows 7. the directx11.1/11.2 libraries dont seem to be fully supported under windows 7.i did a quick hack to prove this by copying the sharpdx 2.6.3 directx11 libraries in. i also had to revert the changes made to soundeffect.xaudio.cs after i did this to get it compiling. sound effects started working again with these changes.im more than happy to make a pull request for this. but i wasnt sure whether to use the sharpdx directx11-net40 or the directx11-signed-net40 libraries though...

Title_Description: mediaplayer.volume adjustement only works on 1st played song hi therei am having problems adjusting the volume of songs while playing. i noticed that it works fine with the first song played after app launch but any subsequent song played cant have their volume changed (with the exception of mediaplayer.volume = 0.0f which correctly totally mutes the song).platform windx.possible related issues 3884edit it seems to be a problem with the mediasession and mediafactory.getservice(session mediaservicekeys.streamvolume audiostreamvolumeguid out volumeobj);. if i force the recreation of a new mediasession at each play it works. so it looks like there is a problem with retrieving the correct audiostreamvolume for the given song stream. most probably related to the fact that topology updates are async (and therefore still bound to the previous stream somehow when trying to retriever the stream volume controller).most xaudio2 media session impletations seem to re-create a session at every play because media session updates are async. so if you guys are ok with that i can submit a pr that shutdown media sessions upon stop and start a fresh one upon start.it is also because of those async initialisations that getting the audio stream volume controller may fail (and needs to wait). i can clean that up and init it once the topology is correctly set (you can know that with the mediaevent callback).let me know if that sound coherent.

Title_Description: specialize spritebatch draw methods while  nkast has done some great work with his low level optimizations there is still more to be done.  for example all of these functions in spritebatch   all redirect to the same drawinternal method which does a common set of optimizations.  we do this mainly to make the code easier to read and maintain as well as to void bugs.  this however comes at the expensive of performance.  take void draw(texture2d texture vector2 position color color) for example.  this draw doesnt need rotation doesnt need flipping of sprites doesnt need uv calculations.  if this function created its own spritebatchitem internally it could do so much more efficiently than drawinternal does now.  same goes for the other specializations of draw and drawfont in spritebatch.  this matters when games are drawing 1000s for sprites per frame.  while this does mean a lot more duplicate code... it also means much more performance.  we can deal with the issue of duplicate code via more unit tests.  performance here is more important.
Name: help wanted| performance

Title_Description: game events (initializationevent loadcontentevent etc) there should be pre execution and post events for things in the game class.  base.initialize and other overridden methods shouldnt rely on being executed last and could benefit by being called one after another wherever the first gets called instead of being chained.  a use case for an initializationevent in the pre execution state would be as follows initializing classes that are required before initialization gets called. i realize this is a broad use case but it covers a lot of different scenarios.

Title_Description: xml doc request would it be possible to include xml schema in the monogame documentation for the serializable classes(including reflection and helpers)?  while the helper classes would need to be manually updated (include a comment to ensure changes are reflected in the documentation) the reflective serializer can utilize xsd.exe to generate the proper schema and wrap it with the appropriate tags.  i have concluded that attempting to solve 4792 the only solutions utilizing xmlreader.create() instead of xmltextreader forces any solution that exists to be in exponential time.    while i could mitigate the problems by eliminating already read elements i do not feel like my approach is the appropriate solution given my solution only works for basic cases. i am opting for option b to the original problem. give the user the needed feedback to correct the situation. instead of only informing the user the the expected element is missing;  give the user the expected element and a reference to the expected schema. even if the proper schema is not available; this would inform the user of the out-of-order elements and the opportunity to correct them instead of only informing of the missing element.  i hope to provide a pr with this issue to inform the user the element is out of order(already in the works)  i also wish to return a reference the appropriate schema to be utilized when implementing the class(hence the issue).

Title_Description: make monogame.net website use https instead of http there are many reasons to use https. its not just about securing sites with login information. sites using plain http are prone to hijacking. it wouldnt be good if a malicious man-in-the-middle decided to inject ads or malware onto monogame.net. [some isps also inject unwanted content into http sites.](  services such as [lets encrypt]( make getting started with https fairly easy to do.  once monogame.net has https support its also important to redirect users to the https version of the site if they load the http version to ensure that the users are using the secure version.

Title_Description: new spritefont kerning list can not be smaller than character list when programmatically creating a new spritefont the list of kernings cannot be smaller than the character list this is odd since not all characters need to have kernings when working with for example windows fonts.  if the kerning list is smaller than character list youll get this exception  system.argumentoutofrangeexception index was out of range. must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection. parameter name index  ive tracked it down to this line and the lines below it    im using windows getkerningpairs and how i understand it to work is that the font has a list of kernings it will apply to a string of characters when it checks that string with the kerning list. so each character could have multiple kernings with multiple other characters.  but the way its in monogame is strange in the spritefont source code we can see that each character in a new spritefont has to have a kerning and only one.  this is how i get the kerningpairs of a font in windows (note that its in vb.net)    doing it this way will give kernings where one of the two pairs appear multiple times.  with the way kernings are used in monogame it seems better to use vector3.zero in the entire kerning list otherwise youll be limited to one pair for each character which have made it difficult to render text intuitively with a new spritefont we also have to keep in mind that spacing is still applied too.

Title_Description: graphicsdevice.opengl maxtextureslots is incorrectly determined  in graphicsdevice.opengl.cs platformsetup()  maxtextureslots is determined using         gl.getinteger(getpname.maxtextureimageunits out maxtextureslots);  and later used by texturecollection  in texturecollection.opengl.cs platformsettextures  the range used with gl.activetexture(textureunit.texture0 + i) is bound by maxtextureslots value.  however the documentation of gl.activetexture() says the limit is gl_max_combined_texture_image_units -1  which in my test setup (ubuntu 18.04 in virtualbox) is reporting 8 instead of 32 for maxtextureimageunits which is causing glerror 1282     what version of monogame does the bug occur on - head   what operating system are you using - linux   what monogame platform are you using - desktopgl

Title_Description: opening up brute < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- this is not about mg itself but a core component that allows mg to run on consoles - [brute]( aside from the console-specific bits is there a reason its not widely available and open? theres a lack of quality open-source il to c++ transpilers and id imagine this would create a lot of new opportunities regarding .net game development including on desktop mobile and especially web platforms.  currently available .net aot options (feel free to enlighten me) -   .net native   - specific to windows/uwp. -   corert   - in a preview state and may or may not ever fully develop as good as it currently is. -   unity il2cpp   - locked down and deeply tied to their proprietary engine.  based on brutes website brute sounds like an ideal tool to have an open community of collaborators and users. we know how well it works on consoles due to all the mg games developed for them. id love to have a discussion about this and learn more since i dont have access to the tool.  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - develop   what operating system are you using - windows linux   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - desktopgl

Title_Description: issues on fire hd 10 generation 8/9 tablets (openal problem?) we have had some issues reported to us recently regarding our clients game on the amazon app store.  it seems this issue has started occurring fairly recently and they all report they are on a kindle fire hd 10 tablet (gen 8+  doesnt occur on our fire hd 10 gen 7).    we only have fairly vague bug reports from customers but largely they seem to say it wont launch at all.  and one or two report it either wont install or will crash part way through loading.   its a paid app so people are raging pretty hard and requesting refunds.  we have a couple of these tablets on their way so hopefully we can reproduce on a device when it arrives.   in the meantime amazon have supplied a log of the crash.  trawling through it i dont see a much apart from openal failing to initialise.  relevant part of logs below    does this seem something likely to cause the app to fail launching?  after openal fails to initialise the next part of the logs shows some audio getting loaded.  id have to double check but from what i remember audio is the first thing we load.   any help would be much appreciated got a pretty unhappy client on our hands )  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - latest dev version - 3.8.0.1018   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - android(fire os)

Title_Description: macos not looking in frameworks for .dylibs in .app bundles < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- when loading libraries such as sdl on macos monogame looks in the directory of the microsoft.xna.framework assembly. this means the .dylib files must be in the same folder as the .dll files (or executable if using mkbundle) for monogame to load them but this shouldnt be relied on for .app bundles.  according to the [official documentation]( the sdl and openal dylibs would be better suited in the frameworks folder of an app bundle so the game uses the packaged version of the dylibs instead of a shared version that may be installed. loading the libraries in the same folder as the assembly may work now but theres no telling if this will change in future versions of macos .app bundles not to mention certification for the app store.  the [openal]( and [sdl]( library loaders can be changed to look for the files in ../frameworks/ first if the platform is osx then default to the current directory if not found or vice versa. basically something similar to what [titlecontainer already does](  < -- system stats --  what version of monogame does the bug occur on - develop   what operating system are you using - macos   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - desktopgl
Name: unknown

Title_Description: sdl gamepad memory leak < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- the [documentation for sdl_gamecontrollermapping]( explicitly states that the returned string must be freed with sdl_free(). [monogames implementation]( gets gamepad mappings and converts the native strings to .net strings but the associated intptr is never freed. this happens every time [platformgetcapabilities is called]( on a connected gamepad.  a simple fix would be to pass the intptr into sdl_free in getmapping right after obtaining the .net string but before returning it.   < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - develop   what operating system are you using - windows linux   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - desktopgl

Title_Description: immediate crash on startup on ipad 3 running ios 9 < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  monogame crashes during initialization on an ipad 3 physical device running ios 9.  the current monogame initialization code incorrectly assumes that gles 3 is available on a device if the ios version number is 7 or higher.  in fact some devices such as the ipad 3 do not support gles 3 but they do support ios versions up to 9.  the proposed fix is to first attempt to initialize gles 3 and if that fails fall back to gles 2 per the [apple developer documentation]( (see listing 2-1).  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.8   what operating system are you using - macos   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - ios
Name: unknown

Title_Description: content pipeline support for arbitrary text config files (including json yaml etc.) this is a feature request / design review for functionality that im happy to implement   contribute as long as the monogame devs approve of the concept. comments / suggestions welcome    proposal  right now the monogame content pipeline has the ability to import xml files via xmlimporter but many folks would rather keep metadata   config files in a different format such as json windows ini / .cfg files yaml etc.  rather than implementing separate processors for every possible plain-text file format i propose adding a generic textimporter to the content pipeline which simply reads the associated file and presents it to the user as a c string. the user can then parse it with their favorite json / yaml (etc) parser; for example   this  works  but im not proud of it. it feels slightly cursed.   questions    how do we handle the encoding of the input text files? my preference would be to only support utf-8 files or perhaps to make two separate importers utf8importer and utf16importer for the two most-common unicode formats.   expected limitations    we will not handle legacy non-unicode file encodings such as windows code pages shift-jis and so on.    the text file will be loaded into a single string in memory. a user who wants to load a file thats too big to fit in memory should probably implement their own streaming loading system instead of trying to use the proposed textimporter.

Title_Description: windows directx videoplayer leaks large amounts of memory each wmv video played would leak about 75mb of memory rapidly increasing the amount used by the software with disposing the videos doing nothing even after platformdispose was uncommented in video.cs.i spent a while looking into it and came to the conclusion that the cleanup process wasnt being handled correctly; mediafoundation documentation at  describes an asynchronous process of closing the session that needs to be done before the media source then session is disposed. i couldnt find any documentation for disposing media sources without closing the session they had been used with.i came up with a first draft for a set of changes to fix this using 4090s work on mediaplayer as a starting point which move the mediasession into the video class and have a mediasession per video which is closed followed by disposal of the rest of the resources when the video is disposed. they also dispose events received by our callback class since not doing so causes the leak to persist which is something that likely wants to be incorporated in any fixes to mediaplayers disposing of resources too. the changes are at  but this isnt suitable to merge because of some remaining issues i encountered while working on it- the taskscheduler-based dispatching to the ui thread used in 4090 didnt seem to be working right for me it was running things on the thread pool so i had to incorporate the same approach to passing tasks off to the ui thread used on android. i suspect this could have been caused in some fashion by the particular product i was testing with though.- because it needs to invoke to the ui thread several times to raise events before the video enters the playing state after a call to platformplay the loop waiting for the session to enter the playing state in play always fails. im not sure the best way to deal with this but this might not be a problem if the above is fixed since it sleeps in play and .net pumps the message queue while sleeping/blocked on a lock by default.(in our own fork i worked around this by adding a playasync method to videoplayer.cs which dropped the loop-and-sleep-until-state-changed behaviour entirely since it was desirable to make things smoother anyway by letting the rest of the program continue while the video setup happened but this didnt fix the xna compatible api and ive not included it in the linked branch.)
Name: video

Title_Description: what is happening with windows phone 8.1 ? helloid like to reopen this issue with some proof that compositiontarget.rendering is totally broken on wp8.1 (and wp10 at some extent)- using vs2013 crete new visual c - store apps - universal apps project. blank app- add function to mainpage.xaml.cs    - run on wp8.1 device (mine is nokia 920  latest firmware update).tapping the button will print the number of times rendering has been called- now mash the screen with all fingers tapping and dragging. admitely it takes some more time than monogame to crash but i can make it crash in 10-15 seconds- now tap the button. tap no longer works.ok now the weird part. i was writing this message to show the evilness of compositiontarget.rendering affecting touch adding a huge delay to screen rotation increasing global warming and in wp10 i think its the culprit that sometimes randomly the touch locations are portrait when should be landscape.  when i thought... this is weird i cant see why subscribing to compositiontarget can affect this.so at the previous message i removed everything related to compositiontarget and incremented the counter each time the button was pushed. guess what? wp8.1 still stops receiving touches.so creating a simple xaml app adding a button and mashing makes the button (and all touch) stop working in my nokia 920.so my question is... is it just an issue with my nokia 920 or is somebody else able to reproduce this problem? because it seems that everything with xaml in it is freezing when mashing the screen in wp8.1 mode (not a problem in wp8.0) edit ive seen several wp8.1 only games freezing under those conditions and apparently not using monogame at all which would confirm that everything-xaml based on my nokia 920 is affected by this problem.

Title_Description: couple issues with xaudio2 (corruption freeze) hey therewe are getting a few reports related to sfx which may be dependent to a few sound chip manufacturers.here are the issues which may be unrelated but we highly suspect that they are1.   sound corruption   after playing for an extended time (~1 hour) soundeffect / soundeffectinstance get corrupted. all sounds start to crackle a lot. mediaplayer / song are not affected (which seems normal since mediaplayer uses mediafoundation and not xaudio2).2.   freezes / stalls   when sounds start to crackle it is almost certain that playing a non pooled soundeffectinstance (i.e. through soundeffect.createinstance()) will totally stall the game for several seconds. soundeffect.play() (i.e. pooled instances) doesnt stall the game.im totally puzzled about these issues and we havent been able to reproduce them internally which makes me think that they are related to specific sound chips and possibly driver issues.it may also be only related to looped soundeffectinstance because they tend to make the game stall more often/quickly.i also dont know why only non-pooled instances are making the game to stall. i would suspect an hardware instance limit but since the pool doesnt have a limit on windows platforms the problem would have been exposed way before any non-pooled instance is played.i havent found the time to test that against openal.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: thumbstick inputs being clipped when using circular deadzone ive been working on improving and fine-tuning controller input for my game recently and ive noticed when using the circular deadzone setting that the thumbsticks feel a bit too touchy.after doing some investigation i found that the method being used in monogame seems to be incorrect. here is a graph showing what its currently doing. the colours represent the resulting thumbstick vector length blue = 0 (i.e. the deadzone) green = normal range yellow = 1 (i.e. full movement) [circular_deadzone_with_circular_gate](so you can see from the big thick yellow area that the values are being clipped. this results in a halfway movement of the thumbstick being equivalent to a full movement. this is not what id expect. and looking at shawn hargreaves blog article on this subject ( the graphs he provided dont seem to show any clipping being done like this. so im assuming this behaviour is actually incorrect.this is my expectation of what the graph should actually look like (which is in line with shawn hargreaves graph) [new_method_with_circular_gate](unless anyone has reason to believe im wrong about this im planning to submit a pr soon which corrects this.also on a related note - while looking into this i came across the gamepadthumbsticks.gate property. i cant seem to find this in xna so i assume its been added to monogame for some reason? im not sure exactly why this setting is needed but the default for it is gatetype.round (which normalises the thumbstick vector if its length is greater than 1). so if i set it to gatetype.none then the above graph now looks like this [circular_deadzone_with_no_gate](red means that the vector length exceeds the expected maximum of 1. so basically gatetype.round was hiding these out of range values coming from the circular deadzone function.does anyone know why this gate property was added to monogame? it seems unnecessary as the deadzone setting could be controlling this (ie. gamepaddeadzone.independentaxes = gatetype.square  gamepaddeadzone.circular = gatetype.round gamepaddeadzone.none = gatetype.none). i have a funny feeling that it might have been added to correct these out of range values so it might be unnecessary if this was the reason.

Title_Description: get color by name it would be nice if we can get color by its name (string).  a good example would be scripting. you get the color from a file as a string and you have to convert it to color. right now the only way to achieve this is to use reflection which is both slow and error-prone (you risk getting a non-color property for instance so you have to check) or make a library class (basically a dictionary) and enter all of them on your own. the second solution is fine if you want to support only a handful of colors but it will become a real chore to input if you want to have all 140 of them.  i have a few ideas of how to implement this 1. use static dictionary<string color to store the colors. the static constructor will set the colors in the dictionary and the color properties will become just getters that will get the color from the dictionary. this way getting the color will be somewhat slower than it is now since it a lookup in the dictionary have to be made.  example   3. use reflection to find the color. this way the only change made would be to write the methods but there would be a big performance penalty because of the reflection. personally i dont like this solution at all although probably its the easiest to implement.  if the admins give it a go i can implement one of the options (preferably the second) and make a pull request.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: reapplying graphicsdevicemanager.applychanges() while .isfullscreen = true may cancel fullscreen when i call graphics.applychanges() while in fullscreen despite having graphics.isfullscreen = true the game reverts back to windowed. this usually happens right when i call .applychanges() again but may occasionally take more attempts.   while in this state the game is effectively windowed but the .isfullscreen property is still true. the problem persists until i set .isfullscreen back to false apply set it back to true and apply again. its especially bothersome when a user tries to change the resolution while in fullscreen as this action requires an .applychanges() call while already in fullscreen thus triggering the problem. the only workaround i see for this is to hop to windowed and back but this looks very ugly.  to replicate create a new project and add the following to the game1 class (rewriting the existing functions where necessary)           keyboardstate last_state;      protected override void initialize() {         last_state = keyboard.getstate();         base.initialize();     }      protected override void update(gametime gametime) {          if(keyboard.getstate().iskeydown(keys.enter)     last_state.iskeydown(keys.enter)) {             graphics.isfullscreen = true;             graphics.applychanges();         }         last_state = keyboard.getstate();          base.update(gametime);     }  when running the game pressing enter the first time will trigger fullscreen as intended. pressing enter again (or in some cases several times) will trigger the problem. the screen is back to windowed and stays there no matter how many times you press enter.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: split mgcb into lib and cli feature request  or rather proposal because id implement this myself if this is accepted.  id like to split mgcb into a dll and a cli so users can easily use the lib in whatever they like to build on top of the mg build system. the pipeline tool could also use that rather than calling the mgcb executable that would be much nicer imo. we could call the class library mgcblib and the cli just mgcb so we dont actually change the name.  i got this idea when looking at the code a bit to check out issues  unclethomy ran into.  that also revealed that the /define option is not actually implemented. id also generally like to make the cli a bit more robust and smarter e.g. by allowing spaces in options (and trimming them).   👍 or 👎?

Title_Description: sharpdx 3.x.x update   upd. the information below is wrong - the performance boost was not from sharpdx improvement but from switching monogame to release build from debug.     ive updated sharpdx to 3.1.0 and got about 300-400  better framerate in our game. sweet  perhaps the improvement is so dramatic because there are a lot of drawcalls (its too early to optimize this in our game yet).  i was needed to fix a few places in master branch of monogame for proper compatibility with it also sharpdx.mathematics.dll should be references now as it was separated from the sharpdl.dll.  there are a few drawbacks starting from 3.0.0 sharpdx requires .net 4.5. and a problem with mgfx - it seems when sharpdx 3.1.0 is used it tries to compile with d3dcompiler_47.dll which is available (and works) only at windows 8.1/10 sdk so windows 7 is not supported. perhaps we need to ask at sharpdx repository about this requirement as i didnt found anything related to this.  regards

Title_Description: problem with graphics.prefermultisampling hi guys  ive noticed that by default if graphics.prefermultisampling is set to true youre using 32 constant value   so it was a complete mystique to me and required debugging (with using monogame source compiled in debug mode) to determine whats going on. of course i was able to fix this by subscribing to preparingdevicesettings and providing proper value to graphicsdeviceinformation.presentationparameters.multisamplecount. but thats not something i wish for other developers to repeat...  i would prefer to have a proper exception thrown instead of using default 32 value which in most cases will lead to these cryptic exceptions. i know its not that easy because of current architecture but we definitely need an improvement in that area. even using default value 1 for maxmultisamplecount will be a better option for now. this way no exception is thrown but developer could quite easily see that multisampling is not working and first thought in that case (at least for me) is that multisample count is set to 1.  regards
Name: unknown

Title_Description: [vr] add a method to get native ptr from a texture hi  im working on a vr implementation with monogame for my game engine. the implementation is almost done however im stuck because i need to have an access to the [textures native pointer](  there is a method called getsharedhandle() that returns an intptr which is what i want. but microsoft doesnt recommand to use it and its not working in my case (it returns intptr.zero).  having access to the native pointer is mandatory for a vr implementation using a compositor (oculus home steamvr and soon osvr). in fact you have to create two rendertarget2d and pass their intptr to the vr sdk (the submit method in my sources).  without that you can only have a non direct mode rendering and have to manage the screen size placement etc. (this is what oculus did when the dk1 was released).  im working on the three implementations (oculus openvr and osvr).  thanks.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: windows storeapps preferredbackbufferwidth/height bug preferredbackbufferwidth/height is wrong at startup when client width<height.  w8.1 / wp8.1 screenshots   [w81](  [wp81](  the cause of this is  which i assume is an attempt to [automatic rotation](   on w10 the values are still wrong during game.initialize(). after initialization w10 receives a sizechange event that restores the values. even if w8.1/wp8.1 got a resize event the same code is present in metrogamewindow.cs (uapgamewindow.cs doesnt swap width/height)   imo its best to remove this code entirely.  a proper implementation would be to change the orientation when supportedorientations= default and the game is fullscreen or runs in fullscreen environment (wpandroidios).  personally i think this behavior is confusing and goes a step too far. i found myself fighting against it in xna in the past when trying to take advantage of the wp7 scaler.

Title_Description: idea add more features to the quaternion struct id like to see the quaternion struct expanded by some new helpful functions and properties because i prefer to do certain things directly via quaternions. a few of my ideas  - normalized the normalized quaternion - inversed the quaternion inverse - isunitquaternion indicates whether the quaternion is a unit quaternion - vector3 toyawpitchroll() converts the quaternion to (yaw-pitch-roll) angles - quaternion pow(float power) pow operation for the quaternion - quaternion sqrt() square root of the quaternion - quaternion log(float base) logarithm of the quaternion - vector3 rotatevector3(vector3) rotates a vector3 by the rotation represented by the quaternion - matrix tomatrix() converts the quaternion into a rotation matrix etc.  i can provide the code but is there any chance that this will make into monogame? if so i would start to write the code.

Title_Description: android game running fine with debugger attached if launched from ide but really laggy otherwise hello there first and foremost thank you for all this amazing work   allas not everything is sunshine as i find myself in a strange situation. as the title says my monogame android game runs fine if launched in debug (so no optimization) from my ide (visual studio 2017 v15.7.6) on my phone (sony xperia z5 compact e5823 android 7.1 - api 25) but if i launch it manually from my phone (no debugger) it is super laggy from stable 60fps to... 5? same if launched in release (with optimization then) and obviously no debugger completely unplayable. the emulator runs it fine. is there something i have completely missed? i thought having a debugger attached would made things slower not the contrary  are some things leveraged to my computer when debugging which make my phone appears to run my game smoothly hiding the fact that its a mess in reality? i am pulling my hair over this.  i tried with both stable and preview last versions 3.6.0.1625 and 3.7.0.1681-develop same thing. my project is built against android 8.1 api 27 with the minimum android version 7.1 api 25. tried it on someone else pixel 2 phone and apparently it runs fine but unplayable on an other one android tablet (dont now which one).  this is my setup in the game class  my game is only using a spritebatch to draw around 650 sprites all from the same sprite sheet so they are batched correctly together although i am using the backtofront mode so there is some sorting (not that changing it to deferred made any difference...). on .netcore monogame on my pc (not a beast i5-3570 cpu 8go ram geforce 660ti windows 10) i can push it to +48k for comparison before breaking from 60fps at 720p. if that is important i am using c7.0 features heavily with span ref return and all for my update logic if it is known to cause problem on android not that i have found anything about that.  but yeah it all boils down to run fine on phone with debugger attached unplayable otherwise / i dont have access to the android profiler with the community version of visual studio so i have no idea what is making it crap itself. any magic checkbox i may have missed?
