Title_Description: add interfaces for high level objects like spritebatch and graphicsdevicemanager  problem  currently it is very difficult to test code which depends on certain parts of monogame such as spritebatch as you cannot mock the object making your tests require actual instances of spritebatch (which in turn requires graphicsdevicemanager instance etc) and while there are some test classes internally in mg source they are not really exposed externally.  due to this the only way to get around it at the moment is to create your own inherited version which tries to counter the underlying behaviour from base classes and also use some pragmas to switch between test code and real code which is very bad as my source code shouldnt need to know it is being tested and would end up with some test specific code being bundled into my actual game source.  i am also wanting to make use of dependency injection which is far better when using interfaces as you are able to bind interfaces to implementations far easier than binding concrete classes to themselves.  there is also the problem that because of not using interfaces a lot of internal mg code is having to use partial classes or other tricks to have platform specific code run i.e winrt sdl related code for graphicsdevicemanager. a lot of this could be avoided if interfaces were adopted for surface api contracts and then composition used within platform specific packages to bundle the specific optimizations/required.   solution  wherever possible on the surface api (ones consumers often use) add interfaces which expose the public methods/properties and use that as the contract on exposed mg code.  for example if we had ispritebatch we could mock this within a test without needing any form of underlying graphics device etc also this would mean that we could easily provide our own implementation if needed and this would also mean that all code depending on this only cares about the surface api contract not the underlying implementation behavior so if you needed to make platform specific optimizations you can do so without effecting the consumer too much as the contract doesnt change just the underlying implementations.   the only down side to adding interfaces and using them as the contract around the framework would be the impact on using interface methods (akin to virtual methods) vs direct calls which depending on throughput can create an almost non existent performance difference.  going forward this allows users to do more with the library in varying scenarios from testing plugins extensibility dependency injection etc and makes the framework easier to chunk up and move towards a more singular monogame.core which could contain all truly shared functionality and interfaces and just have platform specific implementations ultimately making it more flexible going forward.   other info  if you have resharper this is not too difficult to do as you can literally extract interfaces quickly for most objects then just find all usages of that concrete class and replace it wherever needed with an interface.  if there are any performance critical internal pieces by all means skip putting interfaces in but for surface api there is virtually no downside other than the overhead of implementing it.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: gamepad.getstate(int) not preserving controller order on disconnect < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  i am compiling a sample project in the latest version of monogame with plans to port over an existing xna project. in polling the controllers that are active i have the following code (maxplayers defined as 8)      // update previous gamepad states and store the latest state     for(int padindex = 0; padindex < global.maxplayers; ++padindex)     {       m_gamepadprevious[padindex] = m_gamepadcurrent[padindex];       m_gamepadcurrent[padindex] = gamepad.getstate(padindex);        if (m_gamepadcurrent[padindex].buttons.a == buttonstate.pressed)       {         debug.writeline(controller {0} a button pressed padindex);       }     }  this code however doesnt behave the same way as xna. xna - controller index 2 disconnects - controller 2 isconnected = false all controllers before and after this index stay connected with isconnected = true monogame - controller 2 disconnects - controller 2 isconnected = true controllers after this index move down in the array controller 4 shows isconnected = false instead.  if any controllers disconnect the result shows the last controller as disconnected even if any other players controller disconnects.  this causes a huge problem with players controlling other characters.  ive tested this with 3 xbox 360 controllers and 2 xbox one controllers.  is there an easy way to preserve the behavior that xna provides or a code sample i can use to detect the properly assigned controller index that disconnected? im not seeing anything in gamepad or gamepadstate that is obvious. i have 4 xbox 360 and 4 xbox one controllers to use for testing.  edit ive tested this on the latest development build of monogame (3.7.0.1681) and the problem still occurs.  zorcher  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.6 and monogame 3.7   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - windowsuwp

Title_Description: game will not close using window close button (unique situation) i am having an issue with the window/game freezing when clicking the windows x close button.  hold onto your hats. i am going to try to explain this the best that i can and i am sure that the issue has to do with the way i am doing this and using   monogame  .  i just dont know how to fix it.  i am creating a game engine that has a   plugin type architecture  . the whole idea is that my engine will be able to load implementations of various parts of my engine by loading a dll library at runtime that contains those implementations.  doing this will let me (or other developers) actually take only certain parts of my engine and swap out the implementation with another one as long as they adhere to the interfaces provided. this shared library that contains all the interfaces is in its own library.  the implementation library is another separate project.  this implementation library would be the   plugin   for the underlying core of the engine.  so the way it would work would be this.  developer john doe would create a c windows project running .net framework 4.5.  this project is the   game   and would have a reference to my engine library for use.  john doe would then create a c library project using .net framework 4.5 under the same solution.  for this library project he would reference my   engine core   library that contains all of the interfaces that he has to adhere to for my game engine to use the new implementation library he is creating.  this implementation library is loaded during runtime by my game engine.  throughout my engine i use a static class to pull a particular object implementation from the assembly that was loaded and inject it where its needed.   ---  example of usage  i create the windows app reference the game engine.  create another library project called   myimplementationa   and i reference my engine core library.  in the implementation library i just created i would create a class called   texturea   that implements the   itexture   interface that comes from the core library. i write my   implementation   for   texturea  .  now i create another implementation library project called   myimplementationb   and reference my engine core library just like above.  but this time i create a class called   textureb   that implements the   itexture   interface and write its implementation.  now i have 2 assemblies.    myimplementationa.dll   implements   texturea   and   myimplementationb.dll   implements   textureb  .  now at this point i can just simply load either library up and i get that particular functionality.    doing this means that if   deva   wants to use   monogame   to do some of the work for the engine under the hood  and   devb   wants to use   sdl   it will all operate the same.  or they can use something else if they wanted.  now everything i explained above works like a charm.  its pretty awesome and i am very happy with the results.  but.....my implementation that i am using for testing my game engine is monogame.  this means in the implementation library it uses the   game   class.  i am only assuming that this is the cause because i technically am loading the   monogame     game   during runtime from another assembly.  could this be the issue?  i know that it must be obviously running in the same process as my game engine because my engine is the one loading the assembly so that means that   monogame   under the hood would be running in the same process as my engine.  one thing i tried to do is have my engine get access to the   game.exit()   method so that way i could try to exit the game and close the window in code.  this does not work.  it just throws a   system.nullreferenceexception   at the line of code where   game.run()   is used.  this tells me that at this point   game   has been disposed of garbage collected and doesnt exist anymore.  so i guess it is   exiting   but not closing the window.  and with that i think the reason the window doesnt close is because it isnt   attached   to   monogame   anymore.  i know this situation is unique and there are probably a lot of unknowns but at this point i dont know what to do about the issue and really dont want this to prevent me from using   monogame   or any other libraries.  if you need more information or have some questions for me to help you understand dont hesitate to ask.  any help would greatly be appreciated    ---   what operating system are you using - windows 10   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.6   what monogame platform are you using - desktopgl
Name: unknown

Title_Description: sdl_init() call causes a keystroke receiving popup on mac os x catalina resulting in mac app store rejection. < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  on mac os x catalina the call to sdl_init() triggers a keystroke receiving popup - the app would like to receive keystrokes from any application   [image](  this causes rejection in the mac app store review process   guideline 2.4.5(v) - performance  your app requests admin access from the user during operation.  and after requesting more info from the apple reviewer   to resolve this issue it would be appropriate to confirm that you are using  - nsevent.addlocalmonitor  rather than  - cgevent.tapcreate.   in addition it would be appropriate to remove  iohidcheckaccess(kiohidrequesttypelistenevent) for accessing the user’s keystroke under  privacy as apps with this feature are not appropriate for the app store.  the popup appears within the call to sdl_init() in the sdlgameplatform constructor in sdlgameplatform.cs    if one passes 0 to the sdl.init() call instead of the flags above the popup does not appear but instead it appears later on in the creation of sdlgamewindow in  the call to sdl_createwindow() so i cannot see anyway around this.  also calling sdl.init(0) followed by sdl.initsubsystem((int)sdl.initflags.video) the popup is indeed called during the sdl video subsystem initialisation. (note sdl.initsubsystem() is not present in monogame - i added it locally for testing).    < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7   what operating system are you using - mac os x   what monogame platform are you using - desktopgl

Title_Description: path errors on macos 10.15 catalina preventing loading sdl or content < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- im cross-compiling my game built in windows with .net framework 4.7.2 to macos using mkbundle with the mono 5.18.0 runtime for macos 10.9 (64-bit). when double-clicking to run the game the paths do not point to the actual executable which is in home/desktop/folder  - appdomain.currentdomain.basedirectory reports the home folder - typeof(microsoft.xna.framework.color).assembly.location - reports the home folder  this prevents the game from loading native libraries [such as sdl]( and [loading content]( because monogame internally uses these properties. things work fine on windows and linux and if i run the game through the terminal. this prevents me from making an app bundle.  my current workaround for native library loading is to set environment.currentdirectory to the application directory which is retrieved through the native proc_pidpath function on macos using the id of the current process. however all content fails to load because its still looking in the wrong location. ive tried later mono runtimes and they still fail.  ive searched far and wide and i cant find much about this issue. one option is to default to these paths and allow the developer to change them.  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7+ (exact commit a854b98d1832a22cf3e7f61bd88c90e7bf93ef97)   what operating system are you using - macos 10.15 catalina   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - desktopgl

Title_Description: csharp templates issues < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- i am experiencing slight issues with the current csharp templates from nuget in visual studio (2019). i have installed the current templates (monogame.templates.csharp3.8.0.1176-develop)   - via dotnet new monogame.templates.csharp3.8.0.1176-develop as well as   - via the visual studio extension monogame project templates version 1.0.0.  the templates get installed without issues and even show up in the visual studio new project wizard if they are installed via the visual studio extension.  if i than create a new project from the template monogame windows desktop application (windows directx) there are two nuget packages listed in the project   - monogame.content.builder (3.8. )   - monogame.framework.windowsdx (3.8. )  these packages can not be restored by visual studio. a couple of problems occur here - the monogame nuget feed ( lists v3.8.0.1103 as the latest stable version but this version does not seem to be available for download. (visual studio will only use the latest stable version if you reference packages with wildcards.) - the public nuget repository only has monogame 3.7.  packages available. - the package monogame.content.builder is not listed at all. - updating the package monogame.framework.windowsdx in visual studio to the latest preview build (3.8.0.1176-develop) does not work because it complains that the listed latest stable build (3.8.0.1103) is not available. - uninstalling the package monogame.framework.windowsdx in visual studio does not work because it complains that the listed latest stable build (3.8.0.1103) is not available.  to resolve this issue you will have to manually remove the packages from the solution explorer and than install the latest preview build of monogame.framework.windowsdx via nuget package manager.  how to install monogame.content.builder i have no clue. is that necessary at all?  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.8.0.1176   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - windowsdx

Title_Description: monogame.content.builder.task works on english systems only < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  i have integrated monogame.content.builder.task into my project in order to have my content built by mgcb during build. on my german system this throws an exception during build  der ausdruck paket-id      version      befehle      manifest.substring(-1 15) kann nicht ausgewertet werden. startindex darf nicht kleiner als null sein. referencing the file c\users\matth\.nuget\packages\monogame.content.builder.task\3.8.0.1179-develop\build\monogame.content.builder.task.targets  diving into the targets file i discovered that the output of dotnet tool list -local is parsed to discover the installed version of mgcb. the problem here is that the parsing depends on the english column names package id version commands and manifestwhile the columns are named paket-id version befehle and manifest on my german system.  i tried to mitigate the problem by changing the culture for the current thread but that does not effect the commands output.  instead of depending on the exact string one could instead use the column position for e.g. change    that will make the parsing language agnostic. just tested it ok on my german system.  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.8.0.1179   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - windowsdx

Title_Description: [desktopgl] issuing duplicate source ids for sound effects dynamic sound effects and songs < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- because [availablesourcescollection is a list(int) within openalsoundcontroller.cs]( multiple integers of the same value can be added to it.  there are possible instances where releasesource(int sourceid) function can be is called for the same sourceid.  if two sound effect instances end up with the same source id there are invalid operation exceptions within openal leading to sounds not playing dynamic sound effects looping and other problems.  there are a few instances where this has occurred in our projects.    instance a    - when dynamicsoundeffects are disposed [platformdispose() and base.dispose()]( are called.  - [platformdispose() releases the source by calling recyclesource instead of freesource so hassourceid is never set to false](  - base.dispose() calls [base.platformdispose()]( which calls [freesource()]( and [releases the source again](    solution a   this should be as easy as using controller.freesource() instead of [controller.recyclesource()]( and adding a conditional check for hassourceid == true beforehand so it cannot be disposed more than once.  --------------------------------    instance b   unfortunately that is not the only case where this can happen. there is also the possibility that gc tries to dispose soundeffects while soundeffectinstancepool.update() is stopping finished sounds. both of those instances running at the same time result in the available openal sources list being filled with duplicate ids.    solution for b   wrap the freesource() functions within mutex locks so that we can be sure that the source hasnt been freed and the source isnt currently being freed before finally recycling the source.  --------------------------------   < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on monogame desktopgl v3.7.1.189 also occurs on [current]( dev branch.   what operating system are you using windows 10 (also applies to osx catalina and assuming linux oses)   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - desktopgl

Title_Description: bounty update audio system not to drain cpu on android the audio system stays active on android devices and continues to drain battery when monogame apps are in inactive in the background. this has been documented hereand heremonogame issue we wanted to post a  1000 usd bounty for the successful resolution of this issue and its acceptance into the monogame develop branch. it looks like there are two viable solutions one is to compile a new openal-soft library and use the new functions to pause suspend/pause the device when necessary. another would be a fully managed mixer. either way this is a big blocker for anyone pushing games to production on android and we hope for a final solution soon )
Name: unknown

Title_Description: media foundation (song playback on directx) not working on vista helloit appears that song playback doesnt work on windows vista. we have several reports of this exceptionsince we cant debug on users machines i dont have a more precise stack trace with the native debug messages.according to this [sharpdx discussion]( windows vista runs a different media foundation version and may require an update. however after redirecting users to the mentioned update nothing changes and most users report that the update wont even install.at first i thought it was related to 4176 but i can confirm it isnt.the problem seems very rare given that vista users are now very few. there are merely a couple referenced occurrences of that problem on the internet.my best guess would be that the current version of sharpdx targets a media foundation version incompatible with windows vista.this problem added to 4176 and the recent difficulties to rework directx song playback make me wonder if it would be interesting to switch to another api at least for the windows desktop platform (the other windows platforms are most probably not affected by media foundation dependencies).
Name: unknown

Title_Description: fix texture2d.validateparams() for compressed formats the current implementation of texture2d.validateparams() is broken for compressed formats (likely for all... but in particular pvrtc).  this is a critical issue that needs to be resolve asap as it makes monogame useless for most game development.  it doesnt consider bits per pixel or that there is a min size for some mip levels.  you can see my findings here     we need to add some specific unit tests for setting/getting data on compressed formats including data on every mip level.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: purge calls of gl.generatemipmap from texture constructors in texture2d in particular it calls gl.generatemipmap in some form to fill out the mip map chain.  this is wrong.  gl.generatemipmap literally means generate mip maps from the level 0 data now.  it reads each pixel of the level 0 data and filters it down to generate mips.  depending on the target platform on the cpu or the gpu.  it should be painfully obvious that doing this on a empty texture is a waste of time.  also you cannot call gl.generatemipmap on compressed textures as gl will not auto generate mips for compressed formats.  it would require gl to compress the texture at runtime which it does not do.  so currently this fails for compressed formats.  versions of monogame from just 6 months ago didnt call gl.generatemipmap at all    ~~so either a~~    - ~~we stop calling gl.generatemipmap and do nothing for mipmaps on construction (which i dont know is correct).~~  or b   - we correctly define mip levels on a texture by writing a loop and calling gl.compressedteximage2d or gl.teximage2d for each level.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: fix or remove checkedrect from texture2d set/getdata the checkedrect change in texture2d set/getdata is broken for compressed texture formats    it doesnt consider that for compressed formats there is a minimum mipmap size that must be enforced.  so it passes the incorrect rectangle down to methods for setting the texture data.  imo we sure purge this  checkedrect business entirely from the code base.  in particular the removal of calling setdata with a null rectangle is likely a performance hit.  i am willing to bet that for example gl.texsubimage2d is slower than gl.teximage2d when setting texture data.  same with the methods under directx when the full texture level was being set instead of a sub-rectangle of the texture surface.  imo we need to refactor all this to restore the old behavior for null rectangles and fix the checking when a rectangle is passed to consider compression needs.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: [w10/coreapplication] game loop doesnt run. probably the bug surface due to the new way of event processing on storeapps but the root of the problem i believe it to be 2084. the app stays forever in isactive=false and the game loop doesnt run.   thats a break from xna behavior. update/draw should always be called and its up to the game dev to check game.isactive and skip physics  pause the game or whatever.  i suppose we should revert 2084. if there are issues with suspend and store certification those should be handled independently on lost of focus   minimize.

Title_Description: maximize windows in my game i want to have a maximized window that is not full-screen.  sdl supports this with sdl_maximizewindow however the sdl class is internal so my game doesnt have access to it.  so i threaded the function call through gamewindow like this  by adding a new public maximize() minimize() and restore() function to gamewindow sdlgamewindow and the appropriate function pointers inside sdl.window.    is this something for which i should create a pr? (but finish it up by adding the functionality to the other desktop platforms)    or would it be better to mark sdl as public so my game code can call it directly.  i also have another issue with windows where a stylus doesnt register as down for a half second.  which is infuriating. but can be turned off if you have the hwnd through some special win32 api magic.     so i had to add the sdl_getwindowwminfo function pointer and then add a new hwnd property since gamewindow.handle and sdlgamewindow._handle point to the sdl_window and not the hwnd.     or if i made sdl public then i wouldnt have to create the new property.  what kind of pr would you rather see?  im new to monogame so im not sure if its better to abstract everything and thread functionality through the main classes or provide a set of public apis that you can optionally access if you want.

Title_Description: spritebatch with custom effect is not applying the matrix transform to the correct effect during setup() its instead saving the multiplied matrix   - matrix.multiply(ref _matrix ref projection out projection); to the   - _matrixtransform.setvalue(projection); that is a readonly and is never updated when a custom effect is added to the sb.begin.  - readonly effectparameter _matrixtransform;  im not sure if this is an easy fix or is instead very complex due to not all effects expose a matrixtransform parameter. but the spritebatch should at least warn the user that the projection matrix must be set by hand and the one that is given to the begin() method will be discarded. hope i was clear enough.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: constant buffer overrun on desktopgl when using a shader under desktopgl we get the following exception     the error occurs at [1].  for this shader the offset is 64 the length of the _buffer is 112 bit the size of the data is 4 4 4. which override the end of the buffer.  the sample shader is over at [2].   tomspilman  jjagg any idea which the shade compiler is not creating a buffer of the correct length?  [1]  [2]
Name: linux| opengl

Title_Description: [linux installer] fix monodevelop addin installation the installer is launching mdtool with root privileges which can cause problems if monodevelop was never opened beforehand (since it will create some files which require root access).   tomspilman  konajugames  dellis1972 add this to 3.6.1 release milestone its very important.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: include a default launchscreen.storyboard in the ios template when adding a monogame ios application to a project and you run your game on an iphone 7 plus (and likely other devices) it doesnt render fullscreen. it looks like the whole thing is being scaled up inappropriately.  a good fix is to add a storyboard to serve as a launch screen. then ios realizes the app supports the larger resolutions and displays you in fullscreen as you likely intend.  itd be great if monogame included one by default or at least some default such that ios will render the game fullscreen and the devices native resolution.
Name: help wanted| ios

Title_Description: fontdescriptionprocessor should also check users local fonts folder on mac fontdescriptionprocessor currently wont pick up any fonts in ~/library/fonts but it does pick up fonts from /library/fonts.  when you install fonts on a mac i believe it defaults to your local folder so its a little confusing that the content pipeline doesnt pick it up.
Name: contentpipeline| font

Title_Description: visual studio templates not being installed hello...  when i moved over my game development projects to visual studio 2015 with monogame 3.5 i noticed that the project templates were not installed and subsequently not showing up in the c templates selection.  however since my projects were correctly referencing the monogame assemblies i had no issues running my work.  i only noticed this when i wanted to test out a new monogame extension.  i uninstalled monogame 3.5 believing it was an issue with my current installation and performed a re-install.  however during the re-install process all of the available template selections were grayed out and not selectable as a result.  i cancelled the installation and tried the monogame 3.6 installation finding the same issue.  this appears to be a rather substantial issue on the forums.  can you supply either good documentation on how to work around this issue or correct the installation application so that we can select our vs templates and get them installed in the proper vs template directories.  i have gone through a number of forum postings and there is a lot of confusion as to what to actually do and only a few of them have the proper link to the templates download on dropbox.  i got mine working as a result but lesser experienced people will have terrible issues with this.  thank you...  steve naidamast sr. software engineer blackfalconsoftware outlook.com
Name: unknown

Title_Description: pipeline tool file linking hello  ive been patching the pipeline tool to accept linked files.    some notes    the patch includes  vchelaru s pr to support links in mgcb   with the addition of links to copied files which were missing (im so lame at git that i had to copy them manually to my repository)   when deleting linked files linked to appears in the delete list to show theyre linked files. there is surely a better way.   to mimic visual studio links when using alt key to drag/drop files no confirmation is required and link is selected as well as applytoall.   to mimic vs when adding links that are not included in the project (because they already are included) a message box is shown. (in vs it appears in the log but i didnt find a log to include it and it was very confusing when files were not added without apparent reason). the message does not appear when copying (unless i messed up)   unfortunately using git when other human users are around is too much for an old git like me (pun intended) and ive set up a project and uploaded all the changes there (thats the most i can do in git without spending an hour looking at documentation). here it is     (i dont even know if this is the link i should be posting xd )   it also mixes several different features in a single pr which shouldnt be done and some variable names might not be congruent with the coding style of the project. not even mentioning tabs and spaces and formatting )  finally i have no idea at all of the pipeline tool so some pieces of code are more a dirty hack than a nice piece for a pr. i just hope the repository is useful to somebody with more pipeline tool knowledge to integrate it. on the bright side ive overcommented some parts to give the integrator a clue of what im doing )     missing features i havent been able to figure out   when deleting a linked file the tree is not updated (i spent hours trying to figure why so i left it blank). when deleting folders it is ok.  it is very annoying (do you have any clue  cra0zy ? )   icons should have a link icon when linking.   to mimic visual studio links deleting a bunch of linked files should show no delete confirmation.   the linking system is a bit sensitive when it founds \\ instead of / which shouldnt appear unless you edit the mgcb manually. i suppose the fix to this problem should be when loading the file from disk so i decided not to touch that.   renaming linked assets do not work (its easily doable but i dont know if it should be done. vs wont let you)   some bits will only work in windows (no idea of xwt sorry)  ive been testing this for a few days with 2 of my projects without problems but maybe my workflow doesnt show them. at least i think its a good starting port to support file linking referred in 5109
Name: unknown

Title_Description: spritebatch.end() doesnt check for begin() as per the documentation spritebatch.end() should throw an invalidoperationexception exception if begin() has not been called.    somehow this got lost in some refactor.  we need to add this check back into the codebase.  also we need to add to our unit tests a check to ensure spritebatch.begin() and spritebatch.end() throw the correct exceptions.
Name: help wanted

Title_Description: synchronizewithverticalretrace does not work during game in opengl on windows (ver. 3.6) i switch our project to version 3.6 of monogame (opengl on windows) and i found that graphicsdevicemanager.synchronizewithverticalretrace does not work anymore.  it works just on initialization state - there i can set synchronizewithverticalretrace successfully but when i am trying switch synchronisation during the game - nothing happened. i am calling graphicsdevicemanager.applychanges() but it stay unchanged.  in old version 3.5 it works properly.
Name: help wanted| opengl

Title_Description: add a new label for beginning contributors ive seen this on other projects on gihub and i think it could help encourage contribution to the project. at least that is the case for me. i would be interested in contributing to monogame but since my c-skills are still a bit limited and so is my time. it would be helpful if i could more easily identify issues that require less knowledge of monogame.  a label like beginner friedly or for beginners could very much help with that. as it stands now i woud have to scan through all the issues (at least the ones with help wanted) and then start looking at the corresponding postitions in the code. if im lucky i might find something that i feel comfortable working on if im not i have to start that process over. and all of that takes some time.  working in issues that require less initial knowledge could also help increase my knowledge of c and monogame in general so over time it would be possible to tackle bigger problems.   edit i should propbably add that im not really used to working with labels myself so if this is actually a thing with the people creating issues then it would be nice if use of such a label where appropriate would be encouraged.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: pipelinetool - incorrect display (dev branch 3.7) hi i have noticed since the build 313 that the tools displays incorrectly folders (windows7 x64 i have no other os to test with right now) - the + has vanished when a folder can be expanded. - the content of 2 folders at the same level cannot be expanded - files in an expanded folder are not always indented in the folder (same vertical line as the containing folder) (1st screenshot basicscene should be indented to appear in the scene folder) - folders too (for ex 3rd screenshot the folder space is in modelsb) - the scrollbar on the right cannot be used (2nd screenshot)   [capture bad indentation](  [capture scrollbar](  [capture folder](

Title_Description: sharpdx.sharpdxexception when loading sm4.0 (or higher) effect with reach-profile it seems like the default graphicsprofile is set to reach now instead of hidef. which is fine but because i didnt know this i tried to load an sm5.0-effect with the reach-profile and got the following exception   sharpdx.sharpdxexception hresult [0x80070057] module [general] apicode [e_invalidarg/invalid  arguments] message falscher parameter.      this exception is thrown in the createpixelshader-function of the shader-class and because this exception isnt really helpful i think that  - the pipeline-tool should throw an error if someone tries to compile an effect with sm4.0 (or higher) when the graphicsprofile is set to reach. - monogame should throw an exception that tells the user to either use the hidef-profile or compile his effect with sm4.0-level 9.3
Name: feature request| help wanted

Title_Description: itunes connect rejects mac binary due to qtkit dependency my mac app store submission was rejected with the following response from itunes connect     deprecated api usage   - apple no longer accepts submissions of apps that use quicktime or qtkit apis.  i dont have any references to quicktime in my project so i assume this comes from a monogame dependency?  im using the monogame desktopgl framework with native references to sdl2 and openal.  if this is a monogame issue some guidance as to how to build a game that can pass the mac app store submission criteria would be appreciated.  thanks  -david

Title_Description: master branch and v3.7 tag are out of sync  issue as far as i can understand the [master]( branch is supposed to always point to the latest release tag. in this case [v3.7]( the current git log looks like this   where upstream remote is monogame and origin is my form. it appears that master pointed to v3.6 while that one was the latest release.  it looks like 76cb3d64e and 3d26a001c both supplied the same changes (update changelog for 3.7 release) and at the same time but for some reason diverged the history.   proposed resolution git diff master v3.7 produces no output so the code is at least identical. the only reasonable change i can think of (if any change at all should be done) would be to move the v3.7 tag from 3d26a001c to 0146cf60f. looking at the previous releases the tags were always assigned to master once it merged the latest release changes. so this is what should have happened at least.  that can obviously be a bad idea if anyone (foolishly) has added commits on their fork to the v3.7 tag.  im not sure how big of a deal this is but i thought it would be worth bringing up.

Title_Description: qol its been needed for a long time. minor quality of life addition to the rectangle class. this is a proposal for 3 rectangle overloads locationvector sizevector and centervector that return vector2s. these are supplemental to the existing location propertys that return points of the same name without the word vector appended at the end.  motivation...  today for the umpteenth time i drew a rectangle.  _rectangle r = new rectangle(100100 200 30); spritebatch.draw(.. r );_  then i drew some text in the rectangle.  _spritebatchdrawstring( ......  r.location  ); // this of course would error._  so...  _vector2 v = new vector2(r.x r.y); spritebatchdrawstring( ......  v  );_  the reverse going from vector2s to rectangle.location or size is annoying and you have to type the cast (int) which i know is sort of a good thing sometimes but honestly in this case not really as it has to be done and will be done anyways  .  with the proposed addition you would have instead.  _spritebatchdrawstring( ......  r.locationvector  );_  .  now you might say this isnt a big deal and you are right.  i typically have as extension methods tovector2() and topoint() lying around. but ... new people dont as well it gets annoying to always have to add them. further this amounts to a extra call or pass and typing every time it has to be done.  how many times have these extra lines been written since the begining of xna or monogame  i submitted a pull request hopefully i did it right.   i know there is cache hit concerns and i didnt try to test for them but i doubt those structs are that big if you guys approve i would also like to submit the following... on the vector2 a point type return getter.  on the point a vector2 type return getter. typically i name my extensions topoint and tovector  it doesnt and probably shouldnt be a overload (because it should be a explicit method or property call) but something like a tovector method or property in the point class (topoint in the vector class) would allow many to get rid of extension methods for something that probably should of been added years ago in xna.  if nothing else to avoid a extra parameter pass between these calls and to keep the code cleaner.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: rectangle<t class < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  the current microsoft.xna.framework.rectangle class only provides option for integer values this limits its usage to rendering and other low precision tasks. which is fine regarding its use cases.  what i am proposing is that we have a new rectangle<t class so that it can store floats doubles etc. this will broaden the usage of the rectangle class so that it can be used in precise calculations such as physics engines etc. and in order to keep compatability with the api we create a rectangle class which inherits from rectangle<int. that way spritebatch and other functionalities would not need modification.    or would it be more appropriate to create an interface for rectangle<t?
Name: feature request

Title_Description: eglmakecurrent fails when returning from sleep mode on firetv devices < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below --  issue so on some amazon firetv devices there is an issue resuming from sleep mode. the game resumes however it is only a black screen with music playing. this is currently blocking an update submission of mine. i say _some_ devices because i actually couldnt reproduce the problem at first i ended up having to do a factory reset on my firetv stick 4k to get the problem to show up. so obviously there is something about this thats partially an issue with the device/os itself however i have found that it is possible to solve the problem on our end.   cause for reference the issues ill describe are in this [monogameandroidgameview.cs](  what ive found is that when the firetv comes out of sleep mode it triggers certain events before monogame is ready. this method must be called __successfully__.   i would be glad to implement either of these solutions (or a proposed 3rd option) but wanted to get feedback on the preferred fix before submitting a pull request.   < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7.1 - current develop branch build   what operating system are you using - windows   what monogame platform are you using < -- e.g. desktopgl windowsdx windowsuwp android -- - android

Title_Description: openal and maximum playing instances helloit looks like the maximum of playing instances on all openal platforms is set to 32 (openalsoundcontroller.max_number_of_sources).however this limit is not considered in soundeffect which has its own soundeffect.max_playing_instances set to int.maxvalue (desktopgl) or 256 (xammac).there is yet another constant in soundeffectinstancepool.max_playing_instances but this one is never used. the soundeffectinstancepool size is soundeffect.max_playing_instances.fix proposal- set soundeffect.max_playing_instances to openalsoundcontroller.max_number_of_sources on all openal platforms and cleaning the duplicated / unused values;p.s. unless explicitly documented it is advised to set openalsoundcontroller.max_number_of_sources to 32 (most modern hardware do 64 but for compatibility it is safer to stick to 32 and there is no way to query this limit by code).p.s. 2 mediaplayer uses 1 unchecked source too which means that the limit of 32 is wrong if the real hardware limit is 32 too.

Title_Description: [openal] buffer limit ? os x crash at 16 in 4403 we discussed about the maximum number of playing sources. it is stated that os x has a limit of 256 sources and 1024 buffers.however im getting a lot of al errors on this line when debugging there are 16 pooled soundeffectinstance in the soundeffetinstancepool and 0 playing instances.this makes me question the 1024 buffers and 256 sources limits.what is strange is that the current source limit of 32 seems fine (openalsoundcontroller.max_number_of_sources). i already played up to 32 sources simultaneously. but the buffer limit looks to be 16... could this be possible?i also noticed that while being pooled soundeffectinstance retain their oalsoundbuffer and create a new oalsoundbuffer when removed from the pool without clearing / reusing the previous one. could this be the cause? but the number of 16 buffers still seem pretty low. cra0zy  dellis1972 any idea?

Title_Description: vertexelementformat.short4 and .color vertexelementformat.short4 and vertexelementformat.color doesnt pass through to shader correctly. instead they screw up the vertex input structure entirely causing other members of the structure also become fancy.these formats must be replaced by vector4 (when porting from xna) to work correctly. at least for color the vertex declaration can be left defined as is just the actual vertex buffer data must be passed as vector4. for short4 such a test cannot be done since that also differs in bit-representation from vector4.platform is directx windows.

Title_Description: pipeline tool lists content processors twice i have a .mgcb project that references dlls with custom content processors. when i load the project in the pipeline tool the first time i see one entry for each of my custom processors. when i reload the mgcb project (without closing the pipeline tool) the custom processors are listed twice [image](i have found the following cause [pipelinetype.cs]( collects the list of processors in [resolveassemblies()]( it first collects all processors of the assemblies which are currently loaded in the appdomain. then it collect all processors from the custom content pipeline dlls referenced in the .mgcb.this works the first time but when the project is reloaded the custom content pipeline dlls are already loaded in the appdomain and resolveassemblies() will find the same processors in both loops and add them twice.in my projects this is only a bit irritating but no real problem. but could this be a problem if a user tests several .mgcb projects that use different versions of a custom content processor dll?a quick fix would be to just ignore duplicate entries. ideally we want to unload custom content processor dlls before loading the next project. however i think it is currently not possible in .net to unload dlls. i think we can only unload whole appdomains.
Name: contentpipeline| help wanted

Title_Description: reporting issues that are happening in raining blobs hello guyshere is a list of issues that happened after the steam release1. game was not working on arch linux with monogame mono kickstart.   i got with the player and solved the issue. since arch linux have newer libraries this was the issue   libgif.so.4 = not found   libpng12.so.0 = not found   and on arch linux he had    libgif.so.7 and libpng16   he added the older libs and the game started working 2. after making it work on arch linux full screen was not working only very small part of the full screen was showing and the rest was transparent you could see the desktop. when going in windowed mode it was fine until he reached 1920x1080 window mode resolution.   also when playing in windowed mode it is not a real window but a black full screen with the game of the windowed mode resolution size.3. i have complaint from 2nd player that the game would not start at all on windows with ati gpu still have to investigate this. a while ago one friend could not start the game at all on different ati gpu pc.4. game is not working properly in full screen on 4k monitors and on mac retina displays. the background is black and the game shows in top left 1/4 of the screen. switching to windowed mode it works fine. i have added window mode resolutions up to 4k and it works with no issues.hope you find this helpful and find a quick solution  cra0zy  mrhelmut  tomspilman i will update you as i find more issues or solutions.thanksendi

Title_Description: refactor graphicsdevice.presentationparameters doing some experimenting against xna for 4425 i found that our implementation of graphicsdevice.presentationparameters is wrong.graphicsdevice.presentationparameters is only the output presentation values representing the state of the graphicsdevice the last time the presentation was changed.this means graphicsdevicemanager shouldnt be making changes to it directly.  instead graphicsdevicemanager should be creating a new presentationparameters object... populating it with the new state... then passing that to graphicsdevicemanager to become the new presentation state.some code that currently fails under monogame

Title_Description: [openal] occasionnal oggstreamer crash ive only seen this happening on os x but given the nature of the problem im pretty sure it can happen on any os depending on the decoding performance.a crash can occur in oggstreamer.fillbuffer() on the al.bufferdata() call with an invalid value al error.al documentation about this error the size parameter is not valid for the format specified the buffer is in use or the data is a null pointer. i havent managed to reproduce it in a debug environment yet but im pretty certain that size and format are always correct and that data cant be null because castbuffer() would throw an exception before the alhelper.check(). hence it most probably mean that a buffer is still in use though it shouldnt if al.sourceunqueuebuffers() returned it...update got it  im testing it before opening a pr.fyi it is a discrepancy of openal across platforms. al.bufferdata() generates this error if the size parameter is 0 on os x while it does nothing on windows. same applies to al.sourcequeuebuffers().

Title_Description: [opentk] dpi scaling is ignored by monogame windows (with 4k displays) and os x (with retina displays) are using a high dpi mode which scales everything to fit high resolutions.opentk has internal mechanisms to handle that automatically but monogame overrides the viewport size (because it assumes it to be the same as the backbuffer which is not correct when it comes to dpi scaling) and this results in cropped or too big viewport.i know that opentk is being replaced but i feel like this is still an important issue and im leaving this here so we can keep that in mind when sdl2 will be in use (note that sdl2 <= 2.0.2 doesnt have dpi scaling support).
Name: unknown

Title_Description: lets talk about desktopgl  i was gonna talk about this in 3831 but that become too crowded.... anyway right now desktopgl is still split into windowsgl and linux projects while we only use binaries from one of those and package it into desktopgl stuff. right now there are 4 possibilities either we  1. merge the projects into one tho that might create a bit of problem for the pipeline tool since it resides in main platform projects  2. keep stuff as they are  3. add a desktopgl platform use it for nuget and keep the rest as is  4. add a desktopgl and macgl platforms to source add windowsgl macgl linuxgl nuget packages and make sure that each platforms package only provides the needed native libs for that platform (bonus we can hardcode libs so there is no config file solves 1 of the problems we have for .net core support)  cc.  tomspilman  hach-que

Title_Description: monogame.framework.portable is broken going by the description the monogame.framework.portable nuget package should be a bait and switch pcl however it does not have the same api surface as the platform specific ones and as a matter of fact is not a bait and switch pcl at all (look at monogame\nugetpackages\monogame.framework.portable.nuspec and the only target is the pcl platform moniker - nuget packages targeting multiple platforms should be structured [like this]( this includes the latest prerelease version as well.  to test create a monogame project (i am using the monogame uwp template) and a pcl project then reference the pcl from the main project.  add the monogame.framework.portable package to the pcl project and try to build youll get a conflict because both the pcl nuget package and the uwp try to copy their different versions of monogame.framework.dll to the same location.  try adding the pcl nuget to both projects instead of the platform specific one and monogame.framework is not present anymore.  this means the only way of sharing code in a game targeting different platforms is to use a shared project like in the template which is not at all good practice.
Name: help wanted

Title_Description: soundeffectinstance doesnt play i created a new monogame.windows (sharpdx) project  loaded blast_mono.wav into a sounfeffect and when trying to play the sound i only get silence.  same example in windowsgl works correctly.  after some research i found that sharpdx.xaudio2 [constructor]( was throwing an exception with the following message  hresult [0x80040154] module [unknown] apicode [unknown/unknown] message unregistered class  i tried to find a solution using the sharpdx currently used by monogame without success.  then i followed the next steps  i upgraded monogame.framework.windows to sharpdx 4.0 upon compiling it gave 3 or 4 errors very easy to fix (rawbool instead of bool and a missing argument in reberb) after compiling and running again it gives more initialization exceptions but this time in the [masteringvoice](  apparently it doesnt like being passed a deviceid = 0 i removed the last three arguments and left the constructor as new masteringvoice(device);  compiled again and it worked  sound was playing   so in order to fix the problem its a matter of upgrading to sharpdx 4.0  and adjusting the masteringvoice constructor.  btw i tried removing deviceid argument from masteringvolume with sharpdx 2.6.3 but it didnt work. given that sharpdx 4.0 is a significant milestone and it seems theres no big hurdles upgrading monogame to sharpdx i would ask to consider upgrading soon.
Name: unknown

Title_Description: sort content in mgcb files currently the content of mgcb files is unsorted.  the content files appear in the file as they exist in memory.  new stuff is added at the end and the order from opening an existing file is preserved.  this seemed like a good idea when i first wrote the code but it completely stinks for merging .mgcb files or when working with multiple people.  if we do a simple sort in pipelineprojectparser.saveproject   this works at the content is always in a consistent order when saving it reduces merge conflicts and makes it easier to compare changes.  the bad part in the code above is that a simple orderby string sort for a file path produces weird results.  there is a .net fiddle example here     if someone can come up with a good sort this would make for a great pr.
Name: contentpipeline| feature request| help wanted

Title_Description: pipeline.exe (mgcb.exe gui tool) reports invalid option with /launchdebugger from the [mgcb.exe documentation]( the command line tool supports a /launchdebugger option parameter to allows debugging of custom pipeline. however when i add this option in the content.mgcb    the pipeline tool reports the following issue content.mgcb unknown option launchdebugger and refuses to load the content file.  currently i circumvented the problem by adding the option /launchdebugger to the monogame.content.builder.targets file after the /quiet option but it would be cool to support the option directly in the pipeline tool.

Title_Description: video player request and problem. the video player really needs a way to set position.  it should have that as it is standard functionality for a video player.  additionally...   it seems that some videos wouldnt play even after being processed thru the pipeline. ill get a null texture returned over and over for some videos.   however using ffmpeg thru the command line i have been testing re-encoding videos to get them to play. pretty much most videos that i have re-encoded thru ffmpeg seem to work after the pipline processes them. (_many that didnt prior to being re-encoded i.e. just built by the pipeline.)_  this is the ffmpeg re-encoding command that seems to work the best for preproccessing mp4s before adding them to the content pipeline.   ffmpeg -y -i +   + inputfilepath +     -cv libx264 -profilev main -levelv 3.0 -ab 128k -vf fps=30 -s 320x240 -ca copy      + outputfilepath  what the major criteria is for it to work or not i cant seem to pinpoint. im thinking its the bitrate but i dunno. if anyone  can shed some light on what the preferred encoding is for videos it would be much appreciated.

Title_Description: gameloop with fixed frame rate 60 fps produce unstable timing < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from   --  < -- write your issue below -- gameloop with fixed frame rate 60 fps produce unstable timing. the problem exist very clearly and should also affect low gpu load. screens with lower refresh rate might not encounter this problem.  i have identified two problems with the gameloop timing.  1. the gameloop drift and is just below 60 fps. this will make at some point one frame loss (same frame drawn twice) 2. when idle and running thread.sleep() timing is cast to (int) making the wait little to short. because it then do retrytick it could make another thread.sleep() that will produce a significant long frame because thread.sleep() is not exactly and often cant produce very short delays.    comment   i suggest that the multiple update() for long framerates and isrunningslowly could be removed or possible made as optional on/off. it is very confusing and hard to understand that there could be multiple updates() for one draw(). (i have comment out the code).    solution   1. make the timing a little faster to produce slightly more than 60 fps. decrease the sleep wait with one ms. this makes the game at some point produce one extra frame. 2. after thread.sleep() dont goto retrytick() move forward instead.    code   < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.6 (with some of 3.7 updates)   what operating system are you using - windows 10  screen with 60 hz refresh rate   what monogame platform are you using - windowsdx
Name: unknown

Title_Description: ext_framebuffer no longer available ive been creating a mostly spritebatch 2d game using the desktopgl template. after recently upgrading my game from monogame 3.6 to 3.7 i started receiving reports that players who could play my game using monogame 3.6 but could no longer play using monogame 3.7.  one of my players has an old intel core 2 duo with integrated graphics. framebuffer support was provided via the ext_framebuffer object. as of this pr (5993) his machine no longer loads the bindframebufferdelegate genframebufferdelegate or any of the other ext functions which eventually leads to a nosuitablegraphicsdeviceexception when trying to call those functions from platformapplyrendertargets in graphicsdevice.opengl.cs.  by bringing back the old ext loading code and code in the framebufferhelper.cs file i was able to compile a monogame dll from the develop branch that he could use. obviously [these changes]( are not suitable for a pr but i was able to prove to myself that these players can still use monogame 3.7+ with very minor modifications.  i guess im wondering if it was intended to drop support for computers that required the ext functions (ie glbindframebufferext) or if this is a valid issue. if its valid i can devote more time and attempt to find a real solution for these players that wont break other devices.  thanks  jc  < -- system stats -- cpu intel core 2 duo 3.00ghz memory 5gb igpu intel q45/q43 express chipset opengl version 2.1 + ext_framebuffer   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.7   what operating system are you using - windows 7 x64   what monogame platform are you using - desktopgl
Name: unknown

Title_Description: practical problem keyboard input. i have been doing quite a bit of text stuff lately and come up on a seemingly unsolvable situation. first problem. the monogame keyboard class is all messed up big time. some keys are straight up missing in the keys enum common ones... less than more than hyphen forward slash ect... in the not so odd case were i want to press control and use that like a command shortcut with another key like w or m i can maybe get it to work with keyboardstate but if want to do this with a special character at all many of them such as a bracket { or < / [ ] ; . keyboard state doesnt actually return a shifted case key properly or un-shifted keys right for that matter. for example here is some test output were i hold shift in all presses notice i get ? instead of / and yet i get . instead of < . while pressing the shifted keys i should get < ? un-shifted the keys i should get are this . / key[0] leftshift iscommand true isshift true isnumeric false ischaracter false isspecialcharacter false key[1] oemcomma iscommand false isshift false isnumeric false ischaracter true isspecialcharacter true key[0] leftshift iscommand true isshift true isnumeric false ischaracter false isspecialcharacter false key[1] oemperiod iscommand false isshift false isnumeric false ischaracter true isspecialcharacter false key[0] leftshift iscommand true isshift true isnumeric false ischaracter false isspecialcharacter false key[1] oemquestion iscommand false isshift false isnumeric false ischaracter true isspecialcharacter true it returns the upper keys and lower keys without pressing anything else as well essentially whats returned in the array is unmodified by shift. the upper key or lower returned key seems random but constantly shift doesnt modify it at all. on the other hand. text input cannot be used to determine a character pressed when something like the control key prevents the event from being raised. also when one presses shift and a letter the passed arguments.key evaluates to keys.none not shift which is inconsistent with the other control keys that raise the event. this leaves you with the only other option being keyboard getstate. the problem with getstate shift its borked big time. which also means the enum for keys has a bunch of codes that getstate never ever return. can i know 100 the shift key characters are the same for the keys someone else presses on there keyboard even if the upper or lower case was consistently returned. shift should be modifying which key is returned.

Title_Description: mgcb dotnetcore install instructions need updating < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from     github issues are only for bug reports / feature requests  if you have a question ask it on the community site   --  < -- write your issue below --  on the current pipeline tool install instructions there is an issue in the instructions   currently it states    the two issue with this (once which will disappear on 3.8 release) are  - currently the dotnet tool install -g dotnet-mgcb-editor will fail without a --version argument as there is no release version.  this will go away with the release but the development version testing will need to ensure to include this argument  - dotnet mgcb-editor --register is highlighted in the instructions as the command to register the mgcb tool which is incorrect.  the line should read     after installing mgcb-editor run mgcb-editor --register from the command prompt to register mgcb editor as the default app for .mgcb files. this currently does not work on macos.     additionally the extended pipeline tool docs also need updating with the 3.8 release    tasks  [ ] update install docs [ ] update readme docs [ ] update monogame installation guides  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.8   what operating system are you using - windows 10

Title_Description: two conflicting utility api namespaces within monogame namespace < --  please make sure that the issue is present in the  develop branch of monogame before reporting   you can download the development build installer from     github issues are only for bug reports / feature requests  if you have a question ask it on the community site   --  < -- write your issue below --  whilst reviewing the api documentation there seems to be two conflicting/overlapping namespaces in the monogame codebase which could lead to confusion  monogame.framework.utilities monogame.utilities  imho there should only be a single monogame utilities namespace to avoid confusion (there is also a monogame.utilities.deflate namespace that will need aligning)  given the breaking nature of monogame 3.8 it would be advisable to align these for the 3.8 release.  < -- system stats --   what version of monogame does the bug occur on - monogame 3.8 development

Title_Description: documentation inconsistancy. applys to all platforms all systems.  the issue is a point of confusion for new people and for reference potentially leading to a failed registration of the pipeline tool.  under getting started.  found here.   at the bottom of the page marked optional which (should be marked recommended). seen before the more detailed instructions with cavets for installing and registering the pipeline tool later on.     to register the mgcb editor tool with windows and visual studio 2019 run the following from the command-prompt.    dotnet tool install --global dotnet-mgcb-editor  mgcb-editor --register   doesnt match the more detailed instructions.  found at the bottom here.    the mgcb editor is published as a .net core tool make sure you have the .net core sdk installed if you wish to install the editor. you can download it here.    in a command prompt/terminal window run the following command to install the mgcb editor    dotnet tool install -g dotnet-mgcb-editor        for development branches you will need to ensure you have the dev channel nuget registered and include the version number in the command for example        dotnet nuget add source -n monogame         dotnet tool install --global dotnet-mgcb-editor --version 3.8.0.1476-develop    after installing mgcb-editor run the following to register the mgcb editor as the default app for mgcb files.    mgcb-editor --register  people using the new version and 2019 are going to use the first set of instructions which can fail. they may not read further to the segment titled tools editor when it doesnt work for the next step after getting started in sequence.  1) their should   only   be one area for installation instructions for any specific thing listing all possible configurations and cavets. 2) other places where there is a required awareness of these instructions should linked to that location. 3) if the majority of use cases apply to a specific topic or a link. then that item should   not   be marked _optional_ but instead either suggested recommended standard or requisite reading.     something that implys that you should now click to here to ensure you have set everything up for your platform.

Title_Description: target netcoreapp3.1 in addition to netstandard2.0 this will allow for the conditional use of new .net core apis that are not included in .net standard. the most interesting are probably system.buffers.arraypool (superseding monogame.framework.utilities.bytebufferpool) and many new method overloads in the bcl with span parameters which might be handy for reducing allocations in some hot paths (im guessing as i dont know the internals of monogame).
